thread.title: Blue Ivy Carter and Schoolboy Q's Daughter Join Pantsuit Nation at the Grammys
thread.title_full: Blue Ivy Carter and Schoolboy Q's Daughter Join Pantsuit Nation at the Grammys

posts.title: Blue Ivy Carter and Schoolboy Q's Daughter Join Pantsuit Nation at the Grammys
posts.text: Rapper Schoolboy Q and his daughter, Joyce, at the 2017 Grammy Awards   Looks like pantsuit nation is taking over for the next generation! At Sunday‚Äôs Grammy Awards, Schoolboy Q took the red carpet in a pink sweatshirt that read ‚ÄúGirl Power‚Äù ‚Äî the perfect piece to complement the outfit of his daughter, Joyce ‚Äî a pink Gucci tux with a matching pink shirt and floral flourish at the neck. She carried a glittering gold purse to bring the whole look together. Another notable pink pantsuit look came from none other than Blue Ivy Carter, who rocked hers with a white ruffled blouse. She carried her essentials in a sparkly pink, cat-shaped purse. Blue Ivy Carter poses with her father, Jay Z, at the 2017 Grammy Awards.   Blue Ivy wore a shirt like the one Joyce rocked at the Grammys for an impromptu photoshoot with her aunt, Solange Knowles months ago. Joyce and Blue Ivy sat right near each other at the Grammys! (Photo: CBS) More Blue, who was seated near Joyce at the Grammys, didn‚Äôt look too impressed by the evening. Photos of her posing with her father, Jay Z, revealed the 5-year-old looking very stern and about her business ‚Äî and, quite frankly, like she just wanted to be left alone. Her look of annoyance pretty much captured what anyone would feel with a bunch of cameras shoved into her face while simply trying to watch a show. Blue Ivy Carter and Jay Z at the 59th Grammy Awards at Staples Centea. (Photo by Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for NARAS) More Blue Ivy Carter and Jay Z at the 59th Grammy Awards in Los Angeles. (Photo by Kevin Mazur/Getty Images for NARAS) More Read More Or is she just dishing out some McKayla Maroney realness ? Either way, both little ladies looked great, and if this is what the future of pantsuit nation looks like, it‚Äôs shaping up to be a bright (pink!) one.

thread.title: Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus will take over from Lionel Messi as the world‚Äôs best player, believes Brazil legend Ronaldinho
thread.title_full: Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus will take over from Lionel Messi as the world‚Äôs best player, believes Brazil legend Ronaldinho

posts.author: jgordon
posts.title: Manchester City star Gabriel Jesus will take over from Lionel Messi as the world‚Äôs best player, believes Brazil legend Ronaldinho
posts.text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments RONALDINHO has tipped Manchester City wonderkid Gabriel Jesus to overtake Lionel Messi as the world‚Äôs best player. 
The Brazilian has got off to a roaring start in the Premier League ‚Äì booting top scorer Sergio Aguero out of the team. PA:Press Association Manchester City to give Gabriel Jesus another chance to prove his class against Bournemouth tonight after an impressive run of form 
And his fellow countryman believes Pep Guardiola has a special talent on his hands in the teen. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Manchester City news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Ronaldinho, 36, said: ‚ÄúManchester City have a very special player with Gabriel Jesus. 
‚ÄúMaybe even, in the future, the best player in the world. Reuters 4 Ronaldinho established himself as world‚Äôs best with Ballon d‚ÄôOr in 2005 
‚ÄúAt the moment it is Messi. I have always said I think one day it will be Neymar. 
‚ÄúBut at 19, in the future, it can be Gabriel. He has all the abilities to make that happen.‚Äù Related Stories Brazil-liant Gabriel Jesus has had no problems settling in at Manchester City... but gets a taste of home at team bonding trip to Brazilian restaurant 'Hello Mum, I love you' Man City star Gabriel Jesus reveals all about his Swansea goal phone celebration 'I CONVERTED JESUS' Fernandinho convinced Brazil pal Gabriel Jesus to choose City over Barca and Real Madrid 'I'm very surprised' Gabriel Jesus admits that even he is shocked by how well he has started at Manchester City KEEP THE FAITH Gabriel Jesus WON'T be able to keep up star performances, warns Manchester City team-mate Fernandinho Gift of the Gab Gabriel Jesus listens to local RADIO to pick up Manchester accent - but has so far only mastered 'mate' 
Jesus, 19, has taken no time at all to get used to his new surroundings after completing his move from Palmeiras, which was agreed last summer. 
And Ronaldinho ‚Äì who won two Fifa World Player of the Year awards and a Ballon d‚ÄôOr ‚Äì was not surprised after watching him score five goals in six internationals. 
He added: ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt always agree that players should always be eased in ‚Äî it depends on the type of player. 
‚ÄúYou look at Gabriel Jesus and he has no fear at all. He just wants to play and show what he can do. 
‚ÄúHe will put in big ¬≠performances against Manchester United, Liverpool, Chelsea and all the other top teams in England. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm pleased he has been named in the Champions League squad and I think he should play, he is full of confidence. Ronaldo, Kaka, myself and, more recently, Neymar were playing at the highest level at a young age. Gabriel is in that ¬≠category.‚Äù Getty Images Ronaldinho thinks both Neymar (left) and Jesuscan both be crowned the wordd‚Äôs best footballer one day Getty Images Fernandinho claims he persuaded Jesus to join Manchester City and has helped him settle along with Fernando Gabriel Jesus gets winner for Manchester City against Swansea 
Brazil internationals Fernandinho and Fernando helped Jesus settle at City, who needed the youngster to hit the ground running and kick-start their season. 
Guardiola said: ‚ÄúFernandinho and Fernando did a really good job because they help him translate things and help him to be here. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs not easy for a young guy to come here and settle in a city during a season, but in the games you have seen what he has done. And not just with the ball, but without it and of course, it‚Äôs good news. 
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre happy with how he‚Äôs done so far.‚Äù 
Manchester City new boy Gabriel Jesus opens up his account against West Ham

thread.title: 7 things bound to happen during Gary Neville's interview with Arsenal Fan TV
thread.title_full: 7 things bound to happen during Gary Neville's interview with Arsenal Fan TV

posts.author: Richard Innes
posts.title: 7 things bound to happen during Gary Neville's interview with Arsenal Fan TV
posts.text:
Sport 7 things bound to happen during Gary Neville's interview with Arsenal Fan TV Certain things you just know are going to come up when the former Man United man appears on the infamous Arsenal channel Share Neville vs Arsenal Fan TV: the internet may struggle to cope (Photo: Getty Images) Share Get Arsenal FC   Could   
It's happening, people. It's actually happening. 
Gary Neville - perhaps the most famous, most respected football pundit in Britain - is ACTUALLY going on Arsenal Fan TV. 
As hard as it is to believe, the men behind the infamous YouTube channel really have pulled off the biggest scoop in the history of angry Arsenal fans ranting online. 
After Neville called one Arsenal supporter "embarrassing" and an "idiot" during the defeat at Chelsea, Arsenal Fan TV invited him to come onto their show to discuss why he had been so critical of anti-Wenger fans. Incredibly, as this clip proves, the former Man United man has accepted the challenge: 
The interview is set to hit the internet later this week. 
And we think we have figured out EXACTLY what will happen when it does‚Ä¶ 1. Football fans will declare their admiration for Neville facing the mob diehard Arsenal fans 
When the idea of Neville appearing on the show was first mooted, no-one really believed it would happen. For starters, the Sky Sports pundit didn't need to make time in his busy schedule to sit down and talk to some potentially hostile Arsenal fans. 
The fact that he has gone out of his way to have this debate is likely to earn him a lot of well-deserved credit. 2. Non-Arsenal fans will be left disgusted by Gooner Claude telling a man who won eight Premier Leagues, two Champions Leagues and 81 England caps that he doesn't know what he's talking about (Photo: YouTube/ArsenalFanTV) 
Sadly inevitable. 3. Neville will ask someone to explain the logic that sees a fan take a preemptive banner slagging off the manager to a game‚Ä¶ just in case Arsenal lose (Photo: Getty Images) 
The story of Kane Hopps - the Arsenal fan Neville labelled "an idiot" for taking his 'Enough Is Enough' banner to Stamford Bridge - is how this all got started. 
Prepare for Neville to pull his brilliant 'eh?' face when they try to explain the logic behind that decision. 4. Neville to ask what "Arsenal are sick, fam" actually means 
Something tells us G-Nev might not be down with the lingo often used on Arsenal Fan TV. 
In fact, if anyone uses any of that Gooner slang, we might see him pull him that face again: 5. Someone to make a I'm-not-serious-but-actually-yes-I-am-a-bit-serious 'joke' about how Neville has always had it in for Arsenal (Photo: Getty) 6. The same person to follow this up by reminding him about Jose Antonio Reyes (Photo: AFP) 
Arsenal fans have never forgiven Neville for booting Jose Antonio Reyes all over Old Trafford in October 2004, during the infamous match where Arsenal's 49-game unbeaten run came to an end. 
After Reyes had nutmegged him, Neville - by his own admission - set about bullying the Spaniard. As he said himself: 
‚ÄúI knew above all that I had to get physical. I had to make Reyes lose his confidence. If there were question marks about him‚Ä¶they were over his temperament. It was my job to expose that weakness.‚Äù 
Expect that to come up at some point‚Ä¶ 7. Neville to shut down the debate by pulling out his phone and play this clip Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now 
OK, maybe this one isn't terribly likely. But we can always dream‚Ä¶ poll loading Was Gary Neville wrong to call the anti-Wenger Arsenal fan an "idiot"? 0+ VOTES SO FAR

thread.title: We can stop the boats and also act decently, fairly and transparently
thread.title_full: We can stop the boats and also act decently, fairly and transparently

posts.author: Frank Brennan, Tim Costello, Robert Manne and John Menadue
posts.title: We can stop the boats and also act decently, fairly and transparently
posts.text:
Opinion We can stop the boats and also act decently, fairly and transparently 
The only way forward in dealing with Manus Island and Nauru is for bipartisan commitment to keep the boats stopped while settling refugees in Australia ‚ÄòProven refugees who are still Australia‚Äôs responsibility have been languishing in camps on Nauru and Manus Island for well over three years.‚Äô Photograph: Rick Rycroft/AP   Monday 13 February 2017 23.49 GMT Last modified on Monday 13 February 2017 23.50 GMT 
P roven refugees who are still Australia‚Äôs responsibility have been languishing in camps on Nauru and Manus Island for well over three years. The Refugee Council of Australia and many community groups are ‚Äúcalling on both major parties to form a bipartisan commitment to immediately evacuate the camps and bring these people to safety‚Äù. This coalition of concerned citizens is right when they claim: ‚ÄúWith the US resettlement deal in serious doubt, the most obvious and humane solution is to clear the camps and bring these people to Australia‚Äù. 
If this call to action were to have any chance of success, Malcolm Turnbull and Bill Shorten would need to agree on the necessary preconditions for keeping the boats stopped, and those of us agitating for the resettlement of proven refugees in Australia would need to accept those preconditions. 
Having now endured two federal elections in which both the Labor party and the Liberal/National Coalition are committed to stopping the boats, concerned citizens need to accept that the boats will remain stopped. Nick Xenophon says Coalition may be 'wasting billions' on defence ‚Äì politics live Read more 
We should be aiming for bothbipartisan commitment and support in the community sector for those diplomatic, intelligence and military initiatives in Indonesia and on the high seas aimed at keeping the boats stopped. Such commitment and support would be possible only if there were a new Australian consensus as to how to stop the boats decently and fairly. 
Our politicians need to be transparent with us, telling us how the Australians and Indonesians with Australian assistance can stop boats. Refugee advocates need to accept that most, if not all, asylum seekers on boats coming from Indonesia are not refugees fleeing persecution in Indonesia. They are desperate people seeking a better life than is on offer in any transit country through which they have passed. 
In August, we wrote : ‚ÄúOur government has a mandate to stop the boats, but they have no mandate to treat people indecently without end simply because they came by boat.‚Äù 
For as long as refugee advocates remain opposed to, or silent about , the preconditions for stopping the boats, the major parties will continue to fudge the solutions for the residual caseloads onshore and offshore, in part because they think any loosening of the arrangements will lead to renewed community pressure not to stop the boats and in part because they argue that if the refugees on Nauru and Manus Island are settled in Australia the people smuggling trade will re-commence. 
This is demonstrably false. Since the announcement of the US deal, despite the government‚Äôs fears about the possible response of the people smugglers and the creation of a naval ‚Äúring of steel‚Äù to safeguard our borders, not one boat has set out from Indonesia to Australia. 
The major political parties are committed to stopping the boats. But their commitment needs to be tempered by their obligation to act decently, fairly and transparently. 
While keeping boats stopped, our politicians would need to remain committed to prompt on-board assessment of any asylum seekers making credible claims of persecution in Indonesia. In addition, boats should only be turned back if that can be done safely, transparently, and legally. 
Back in 2012, Sir Angus Houston, who had been head of armed forces, and Michael L‚ÄôEstrange, who had been head of foreign affairs for the Howard government, were not convinced that it could be done safely and legally. The community is entitled to evidence. We need to know what has changed since 2012. We‚Äôve often heard from government military advisers like Jim Molan that the boats can be stopped. We need to hear from those like Houston and L‚ÄôEstrange that they can be stopped safely and legally. 
Any asylum seeker intercepted at sea must be assessed immediately to determine that they are not fleeing in fear of persecution in Indonesia. If they are, they must be received by Australia for processing. If they are not, then they should be returned safely to Indonesia. 
Australia must do what is necessary to assist Indonesia and the UNHCR to ensure that the necessary protection is provided in Indonesia while refugee claims are processed. This must be done in such a way as not to set up a magnet effect for asylum seekers travelling extra distance to reach Indonesia. With increased military surveillance, intelligence reporting and better diplomatic work, we should be able to keep the boats stopped, thereby reducing the residual caseload of asylum claims in Java. International Criminal Court told Australia's detention regime could be a crime against humanity Read more 
Given that the boats have stopped and will stay stopped, there is no need for continued warehousing on Nauru and Manus Island, nor for ongoing punitive measures for the 30,000 asylum seekers living in the Australian community, still awaiting processing. 
Those proven refugees on Nauru and Manus Island who cannot be resettled in the USA in the near future, or any other appropriate country, should be resettled in Australia, and the 30,000 in limbo in Australia should be processed and granted permanent residence if proved to be refugees. But this will be possible only if groups like the Refugee Council and the coalition of community groups can reach agreement with Messrs Turnbull and Shorten that the time for political point scoring and purist disengagement has past. 
The Refugee Council and coalition of community groups says, ‚ÄúThis is a crisis.‚Äù This crisis can be solved only by the advocates accepting political realities and the politicians agreeing to a bottom line of safety, transparency and legality in the securing of our borders. We Australians have a clear moral obligation to the refugees on Manus Island and Nauru. Discharging that obligation, we also need to assert that we are not prepared to humiliate ourselves at the capricious hands of the present US administration. 
‚Ä¢ Frank Brennan SJ, is the chief executive of Catholic Social Services Australia; Tim Costello is chief advocate for World Vision Australia; Robert Manne is emeritus professor of politics at La Trobe University; John Menadue is a former secretary of the department of immigration.

thread.title: Rihanna and her sparkly hip flask had the most relatable moments from the Grammys
thread.title_full: Rihanna and her sparkly hip flask had the most relatable moments from the Grammys

posts.author: Alim Kheraj
posts.title: Rihanna and her sparkly hip flask had the most relatable moments from the Grammys
posts.text:
Rihanna and her sparkly hip flask had the most relatable moments from the Grammys We‚Äôve all had those moments where we‚Äôve thought about slipping a hip flask into an event to help soothe our nerves. Of course, we never expected to see Rihanna grasping a sparkly hip flask at last night‚Äôs Grammy Awards, but it happened and it‚Äôs absolutely hilarious.
On Sunday night (February 12th) we got our lives watching the 2017 Grammy Awards . Whether it was enjoying Katy Perry‚Äôs performance of ‚ÄúChained To The Rhythm,‚Äù Beyonc√©‚Äôs EPIC Lemonade mini-medley , Demi Lovato‚Äôs Bee Gees tribute , or Adele‚Äôs stunning George Michale tribute , the performances were out of this world.
Similarly, there were more dramatic and hilarious moments than we could count. CeeLo Green rocked up at the awards dressed like a giant Ferrero Rocher, and Adele gave a weepy apology to Beyonc√© for winning the prestigious Album of the Year award.
However, the most relatable moments from last night‚Äôs Grammys came from Rihanna and her sparkly hip flask. Honestly, @rihanna and her diamond flask are my #Grammys goals. pic.twitter.com/fOe69Iypj3 
‚Äî refinery29 (@Refinery29) February 13, 2017 Now, the Grammys are a dry affair, meaning that there‚Äôs no alcohol served during the ceremony. However, this is BadGal RiRi we‚Äôre talking about, and the singer decided to flout the rules by sneaking in her own hip flask. Of course, she was captured on camera sneakily sipping from it, and it has the internet relating HARD.
In one night, Rihanna has:

- served face
- taken multiple shots out of a flask
- FaceTimed
- danced her heart out

God fucking bless.
‚Äî Kevin O'Keeffe (@kevinpokeeffe) February 13, 2017 oh my god Rih and her flask #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/BASBwmEsl2 
‚Äî destiny | 15 (@destinysaidit) February 13, 2017 every thanksgiving dinner pic.twitter.com/iQysElGVU7 
‚Äî Mark (@tole_cover) February 13, 2017 Rihanna with the flask?!?!? pic.twitter.com/gGi8nfPp6O 
‚Äî (@LaLaChannell) February 13, 2017 Rihanna and her flask made my night pic.twitter.com/9B59uvNWlR 
‚Äî Jhennoy (@httpsjhey) February 13, 2017 rihanna is at the grammy's taking shots out of a customized diamond flask she has no chill
‚Äî angie (@rightheredinah) February 13, 2017 mood: Rihanna taking shots out of a bedazzled flask
‚Äî lazuli (@IazuIi) February 13, 2017 Rihanna drinking out of her diamond encrusted flask & passing it around is my mood pic.twitter.com/l54WGvjjqg 
‚Äî na√±i (@pettyblackgirI) February 13, 2017 "I think it's time for another shot" #GRAMMYs pic.twitter.com/5XIyrSmR6U 
‚Äî Rihanna Navy Brasil (@RNavyBrazil) February 13, 2017 Even Rihanna herself noted how people on the internet were finding her hip flask absolutely HILARIOUS. In fact, she shared a pic of her and the flask on Instagram, and we just can‚Äôt get enough of it.
A video posted by badgalriri (@badgalriri) on Feb 12, 2017 at 11:13pm PST 
Ri and her hip flask are now officially our OTP.
Seriously, don‚Äôt ever change RiRi!

posts.title: Carrasco pidi√≥ perd√≥n al vestuario por su ‚Äòmosqueo‚Äô ante el Alav√©s
posts.text:
Chema G. Fuente Madrid Periodista   09:34 
No hay fisuras en el vestuario del Atl√©tico de Madrid. Yannick Carrasco , jugador del cuadro colchonero, ha confesado que su mosqueo tras ser sustituido contra el Deportivo Alav√©s hace unas jornadas no fue un gesto adecuado y se excus√≥ con los compa√±eros del equipo rojiblanco por ello. 
‚ÄúHabl√© con el grupo y ped√≠ perd√≥n por mi actitud tras el cambio ante el Alav√©s, no debe volver a ocurrir‚Äù, explic√≥ el jugador belga en la Cadena Cope , tras el choque de este domingo contra el Celta de Vigo en el que marc√≥ un golazo. 
El jugador tambi√©n habl√≥ de unos supuestos pitos que alg√∫n momento del partido pudo haber por lo sucedido en las √∫ltimas semanas. ‚ÄúLa afici√≥n lo que quiere es que su equipo gane. Yo estoy detr√°s de la afici√≥n‚Äù, se√±al√≥ el jugador para restar importancia. Eso s√≠, aclar√≥ el asunto de jugar a la derecha. ‚ÄúNunca he dicho que yo no quiera jugar por banda. Luego, la gente puede creer lo que quiera creer. La afici√≥n est√° para el equipo, no para un jugador y yo soy del Atl√©tico ‚Äù, afirm√≥ en la Cadena Ser. Comparte en Facebook

thread.title: 'Real-life Notebook' couple with dementia still deeply in love after 50 years - despite not always recognising each other
thread.title_full: 'Real-life Notebook' couple with dementia still deeply in love after 50 years - despite not always recognising each other

posts.author: Sophie Evans
posts.title: 'Real-life Notebook' couple with dementia still deeply in love after 50 years - despite not always recognising each other
posts.text:
Which diseases cause dementia? How do they affect the brain? Share this video Watch Next 
‚ÄúMy mum and dad are soul mates, without a doubt," said James, who works as a Regional Fundraising Officer for Alzheimer‚Äôs Research UK. 
"If my wife and I have half the marriage they‚Äôve got, we‚Äôll be doing just fine. 
‚ÄúMy parents did everything for my two sisters and me and put themselves second, they were a team. 
‚ÄúThese were the years that Ma and Pa were supposed to be able to relax and enjoy the fruits of their labours. 
"They should have been travelling, enjoying being grandparents, visiting family and friends. Instead, they are both in a care home. 
‚ÄúThey‚Äôve both gone downhill a lot in the past year. Read More 
"Trying to get a smile out of my dad these days is incredibly difficult, the only time he really smiles is when he‚Äôs with Mum. 
‚ÄúThey still show that they‚Äôre in love with one another. 
"My mum is very short and my dad holds onto her forearm because he‚Äôs too tall to reach her hand, which we find very funny." 
But James said that, although there are "funny moments", seeing his parents suffer from the effects of dementia is "absolutely heartbreaking". 
"It‚Äôs hard not to talk about them in the past tense because they‚Äôll never be the same people they were," he said. Chris and Hilary, from Dorset, were diagnosed with dementia within just two years of each other (Photo: alzheimersresearchuk.org) 
‚ÄúMum constantly asks where my dad is, even if he‚Äôs standing next to her, and she won‚Äôt always recognise that that‚Äôs him. 
"But there is a constant familiarity there, even if she doesn‚Äôt know it‚Äôs really him she‚Äôll hold his hand and rest her head on his shoulder. 
‚ÄúThey loved walking and would walk for miles and miles, happily taking in where they were and enjoying the time together. 
"We try to take them to the beach and other places where they can walk so they can still do that together. Read More How kind-hearted strangers fulfilled dying wish of parents who passed away after heartbreaking picture 
‚ÄúAs time goes on they will have to have separate bedrooms, and will forget who each other are altogether. 
"This breaks my heart, but I know that somewhere inside them they‚Äôll always remember their love for one another.‚Äù 
James‚Äôs parents have been together for more than 50 years, since 1966. 
When they first became a couple, they were aged just 22 and 19. 
The inseparable pair met when Hilary moved from Dublin to London and visited a post office where Chris was working. 
She said Chris, who later worked at Barclays bank, had short-changed her. In some ways, the pair's love story is reminiscent of the hit 2004 film, The Notebook 
But adamant he had not, Chris asked her out on a date to diffuse the situation. 
The couple married in 1969 and had three children together ‚Äì Joanna in 1970, Victoria in 1971, and James in 1979. 
In 2007, Hilary fell down the stairs and had a brain aneurysm, which led her to develop vascular dementia, which she was diagnosed with just a few years later. 
She would repeatedly go missing after becoming lost and confused. 
Not long after, in 2012, the family were told that Chris had Alzheimer‚Äôs. 
The couple lived in Lytchett Matravers in Dorset from 1984 until 2014. 
They then moved to Parkstone, Dorset, to be right next to their two daughters, before they had to go into full-time care a year ago. Read More Anorexic teenager who lived off diet of water, diet coke and energy drinks illustrates book about beating her demons 
Devastatingly, Chris recently ripped up some treasured love letters, written between his wife and him in the 1960s. 
He had treasured the letters for decades, but destroyed them through frustration with what was happening to him and Hilary. 
They are now being pieced back together by the pensioner's devoted family, who are looking after the documents for him. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now

thread.title: EPA Sued for Mercury Policy
thread.title_full: EPA Sued for Mercury Policy

posts.author: Dr. Mercola
posts.title: EPA Sued for Mercury Policy
posts.text:
EPA Sued for Mercury Policy February 14, 2017 | 2,328 views Please 0 
By Dr. Mercola 
Many people are not aware that, in the U.S., dental offices are the single largest source of mercury at sewage treatment plants. 1 
When dentists discharge mercury from amalgam fillings (also known, misleadingly, as ‚Äúsilver‚Äù fillings) down the drains in their offices, it accumulates in the environment, including in seafood intended for human consumption. 
As a neurotoxin, mercury in the environment is dangerous for everyone, but poses a particularly grave risk for pregnant women, babies and children, in whom it can seriously disrupt brain function and harm the nervous system. 
There was a ray of hope, however, when, in December, 2016, the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) finalized a rule that would restrict dentists' mercury discharges. 
After more than a decade of debating the issue and an additional five years of delays, the EPA finally finalized requirements for dentists placing or removing amalgam to install amalgam separators to reduce their mercury discharge. 
Now, with the changes in administration, that rule has been rolled back, and the EPA is facing a lawsuit because of it. According to the Natural Resources Defense Council (NRDC), which filed the suit, this can‚Äôt legally be done without public notice or a comment period. NRDC‚Äôs litigation director, Aaron Colangelo, said in a statement: 2 
‚ÄúThe Trump White House ordered the EPA and other agencies to violate the law ‚Ä¶ That puts Americans at greater risk of exposure to this dangerous neurotoxin, which can do harm even in tiny amounts. 
‚Ä¶ EPA‚Äôs withdrawal of the mercury rule is not just illegal, but senseless. The rule imposes minimal burden, drew widespread praise from dental providers and benefits public health and the environment.‚Äù Rule Would Reduce Mercury Discharges by 5.1 Tons a Year 
There are 130,000 dental offices in the U.S., about 103,000 of which still use or remove amalgam fillings. 3 
Together, these dentists discharge about 5.1 tons of mercury each year to publically owned water treatment plants and, according to the EPA, ‚Äúmost of this mercury is subsequently released to the environment.‚Äù They explained: 4 
‚ÄúMercury-containing amalgam wastes may find their way into the environment when new fillings are placed or old mercury-containing fillings are drilled out and waste amalgam materials that are flushed into chair-side drains enter the wastewater stream. 
Mercury entering POTWs [publically owned treatment works] frequently partitions into the sludge, the solid material that remains after wastewater is treated. 
Mercury from waste amalgam therefore can make its way into the environment from the POTW through the incineration, landfilling or land application of sludge or through surface water discharge.‚Äù 
While most dental offices use at least a basic filtration system to help cut down on mercury waste entering the sewer system, the rule, known as the Mercury Effluent Rule, would require dental offices to install amalgam separators that capture the mercury (and other metals) before they‚Äôre discharged into the sewer. The mercury can then be recycled. 
Under the rule, existing dental offices would have to install amalgam separators within three years, which was expected to reduce mercury discharge by 5.1 tons and discharge of other metals found in waste dental amalgams by 5.3 tons, annually. 5 
Installing the equipment was estimated to cost only about $800 per office. 6 In a rare show of agreement, all stakeholders were in favor of the rule, even the American Dental Association . 7 NRDC States the EPA Illegally Rescinded the Rule 
The EPA‚Äôs mercury rule was part of a number of public health and environmental protection rules that the White House ordered to be withdrawn early this year. The NRDC‚Äôs lawsuit against the EPA states that the agency acted illegally by withdrawing the rule without public notice or a public comment period. 
According to NRDC, ‚ÄúEPA cannot withdraw the mercury protection rule based on the Trump administration‚Äôs fiat because the rule is final.‚Äù 8 The best solution would be to eliminate mercury from dentistry altogether, but until this happens, separators would at least lessen the environmental burden. 
About 40 percent of U.S. dental offices have already installed the devices, because 12 states have mandatory rules in place to stop mercury from being discharged into wastewater treatment plants. 9 
The current nominee to head the EPA, Scott Pruitt, may not help matters, however, considering he‚Äôs sued the agency in the past to block a rule to limit how much mercury could be emitted into the air by coal plants. 10 It Will Take More Than Amalgam Separators to Stop Mercury Pollution 
The installation of amalgam separators at every dental office using amalgam should be a given, but even that will not go far enough to stop the environmental destruction that results from the continued use of this toxic metal in dentistry. 
Dental mercury pollution enters the water via human waste disposal and dental clinic releases. It enters the land via landfills, human burials and fertilizer. And it enters the air from dental clinic emissions and waste incineration. 
Seven to 9 metric tons of mercury per year escape into the atmosphere during cremations alone, and it is estimated that, left unchecked, crematoria will be the largest single cause of mercury pollution by 2020. European Union Bans Amalgam Fillings for Children and Pregnant or Nursing Women 
While the U.S. EPA has halted even a minimal step to curb mercury pollution from amalgam fillings, the European Union has declared that, starting July 1, 2018, amalgam use will be banned for children under 15 and pregnant or nursing women. 
"The next generation of Europe's children are safe from toxic dental mercury," Charlie Brown, president of Consumers for Dental Choice and the umbrella World Alliance for Mercury-Free Dentistry, said. He continued: 
"This landmark achievement still has to be officially ratified, but all three European Union institutions, the [European] commission, the Council [of the European Union] and the European Parliament have reached consensus. 
The ban on amalgam for children in Europe, we promise you, will reverberate in favor of the children across the world ‚Äî in America North and South, in Africa and in Asia and the Pacific. 
The game changer that will do in amalgam is the Minamata Convention on Mercury, which requires every participating nation to act to reduce amalgam use. The Convention is expected to become legally binding in the middle of 2017." 
Seeing the EU decision as a springboard, Consumers for Dental Choice and the World Alliance for Mercury-Free Dentistry have launched a campaign to ban mercury amalgam for every child everywhere. 
"We target 2020 as victory year for the world's children," said Brown . "This victory for Europe's children will lead us to for the children of Asia, Africa and America North and South. Amalgam belongs only in museums that feature failed medical strategies. " Amalgam Is Inferior to Today‚Äôs Modern Filling Alternatives 
In a press release, British dentist Graeme Munro-Hall, chair of the Transition and Training task force for the World Alliance for Mercury-Free Dentistry, described amalgam as ‚Äúa primitive polluting device‚Äù that‚Äôs ‚Äútechnically inferior to today‚Äôs modern alternatives.‚Äù 11 
One of the most popular alternatives to amalgam is resin composite, which is made of a type of plastic reinforced with powdered glass. It is already common throughout the United States and the rest of the developed world, offering notable improvements over amalgam as it, according to Consumers for Dental Choice: 12 
‚Ä¢ Is environmentally safe: Composite, which contains no mercury, does not pollute the environment. This saves taxpayers from paying the costs of cleaning up dental mercury pollution in our water, air and land ‚Äî and the costs of health problems associated with mercury pollution. 
‚Ä¢ Preserves healthy tooth structure because, unlike amalgam, it does not require the removal of significant amounts of healthy tooth matter. 
Over the long term, composite preserves healthy tooth structure and actually strengthens teeth, leading to better oral health and less extensive dental work over the long-term. 
‚Ä¢ Is long-lasting: While some claim that amalgam fillings last longer than composite fillings, the science reveals this claim to be baseless. The latest studies show that composite not only lasts as long as amalgam, but actually has a higher overall survival rate. 
A lesser-known alternative is increasingly making mercury-free dentistry possible even in the rural areas of developing countries. Atraumatic restorative treatment (also called alternative restorative treatment or ART) is a mercury-free restorative technique that has been demonstrated a success in a diverse array of countries around the world, including Tanzania, India, Brazil, Zimbabwe, Turkey, Peru and more. 
ART relies on adhesive materials for the filling (instead of mercury) and uses only hand instruments to place the filling, making it particularly well-suited for rural areas of developing countries. Important Information About Amalgam Removal 
For those of you who have mercury fillings , I recommend having them very carefully removed by a competent biological dentist who follows professional protocols for amalgam removal. It's very important to have it done correctly. When amalgams are removed, a large amount of mercury is released, and if the proper precautions aren't taken, your body can absorb a massive dose of mercury that can lead to acute kidney problems. 
I experienced this myself more than 20 years ago when I had my amalgams removed by a non-biological dentist. Biological dentists, on the other hand, are well aware of these dangers. Some of the steps that need to be taken to keep you and your dentist safe during amalgam removal include: 
‚úì Providing you with an alternative air source and instructing you not to breathe through your mouth 
‚úì Putting a rubber dam in your mouth so you don't swallow or inhale any toxins, and using a high-volume evacuator near the tooth at all times to evacuate the mercury vapor 
‚úì Using a cold-water spray to minimize mercury vapors 
‚úì Washing your mouth out immediately after the fillings have been removed (the dentist should also change gloves after the removal) 
‚úì Immediately cleaning your protective wear and face once the fillings are removed 
‚úì Using room air purifiers 
If your dentist claims you need to get a new filling, talk to him about the available alternatives to amalgam, and be aware that many dental insurance companies still refuse to completely pay for composite fillings. Some, for instance, will only cover composite fillings on your front teeth while others refuse to pay at all. As a result, people who have dental insurance are actually more likely to get amalgam than those paying out-of-pocket. 13 Demand Your Choice 
Today, about 50 percent of American dentists offer mercury-free dentistry, up from 3 percent 20 years ago. To accelerate change in the U.S., Consumers for Dental Choice is urging all American consumers to demand mercury-free dentistry ‚Äî both from your dentist and from your insurance company. If they refuse, switch dentists; switch insurance. 
At present, many insurance companies, including Delta Dental, Aetna, Equitable and Humana typically will pay only for amalgam in your molars, even though composite, not amalgam, has become the standard and mainstream filling material in North America. 
And, since mercury-free dentists ‚Äî again, about half of all dentists in the U.S. ‚Äî will not give you an amalgam filling anywhere in your mouth, the insurance company profits handsomely since you then have to pay the bill out-of-pocket even though you're insured. As previously noted by Brown: 
"They sell an artificially low-price policy to get you in. That's a bait-and-switch. It's time to hold all of them accountable ‚Ä¶ Challenge your insurance company; demand your claim be paid, and work with your mercury-free dentist to do that. We have the paperwork if you push the 'Demand Your Choice' button ‚Ä¶ We can change this from the grassroots up. We're not going to wait on the FDA ‚Ä¶ We're going to simply change the market."

thread.title: 'They are howling': Premier Rachel Notley jabs at opposition
thread.title_full: 'They are howling': Premier Rachel Notley jabs at opposition

posts.author: cbc
posts.title: 'They are howling': Premier Rachel Notley jabs at opposition
posts.text:
Premier Rachel Notley didn't pull any punches speaking about her opposition at an event at the University of Calgary Saturday.
Speaking to her supporters at MacEwan Hall, Notley said her government is unafraid to take on big tasks ‚Äî something she said previous governments didn't do.
"We're taking on big issues and putting families first," Notley told the crowd. "[It's] a sure-fire way to make our opponents howl ‚Äî and wow, they are howling."
FROM OCTOBER: Notley stands by NDP promises, unafraid of opposition Notley said the "howling" coming from the opposition is often criticism of her policies and government ‚Äî and she said she thinks they will criticize no matter what she does.
"I'd be more willing to let this behaviour slide if it wasn't for the fact that they always, always, always act like this," she said. "They will do anything to score cheap political points ‚Äî even if it means talking Alberta and Albertans down."
Premier Rachel Notley criticized for politicizing government communications She also said the opposition is posting messages on social media criticizing her government's policies, but didn't do nearly enough in their decades of power.
"It's become pretty clear why our opponents never did much when they were in government ‚Äî it was because they were literally terrified of everything," she said.
With the federal Liberal government  approving  the Trans-Mountain and Line 3 pipelines, Notley said her government`s work on the projects shows its commitments to making real change in Alberta. "Working families shouldn't have to choose between their jobs and the environment," she said.
"How did we get those approvals [for the pipelines]? We didn't sling mud, we didn't throw temper tantrums, we didn't take the low road. We'll leave that to the opposition."
As for whether that opposition unites itself, Notley said she isn't concerned about campaigning two years before the next presumed election.
"No matter how they sort themselves out, we'll be ready," she said. "And we'll be ready because we know where we stand and we know where they stand."
What lies ahead for Alberta's unite-the-right effort?

thread.title: NBA scores 2017: Nuggets blow out Warriors in historic shooting night
thread.title_full: NBA scores 2017: Nuggets blow out Warriors in historic shooting night

posts.author: Whitney Medworth
posts.title: NBA scores 2017: Nuggets blow out Warriors in historic shooting night
posts.text: Rec Chris Humphreys-USA TODAY Sports Okay, so the Warriors were without Klay Thompson , Shaun Livingston , Zaza Pachulia , and David West. We‚Äôre also close the All-Star break and teams can taste their upcoming vacations. That said, the Nuggets only had nine players and could have easily chalked this up as a loss before the game even started. But the Nuggets found a way to make it work. For a team that is fighting for a playoff spot, they got their best win of the season. Roles were reversed on Monday as the Nuggets hit 24 three-pointers during the game, tying a league record, and beat the Warriors, 132-110. The Nuggets were up by 25 points at halftime thanks to 16 three-pointers, shooting 70 percent from behind the arc. Other than a run late in the game by the Warriors‚Äô bench, Denver was in control the entire time. Nikola Jokic had a triple-double with 17 points, 21 rebounds, and 12 assists. It was his second triple-double of his career and also his second in the last 10 days. Jokic also set career highs in rebounds and assists. His thoughts on that? "If you look good, you play good." You got that right, big fella #Nuggets pic.twitter.com/Sbj8YEvs7a ‚Äî Denver Nuggets (@nuggets) February 14, 2017 You know who else was a star for the Nuggets? Rookie Juancho Hernangomez. Hernangomez finished with 27 points and 10 rebounds, which were both career highs. ‚Äî Denver Nuggets (@nuggets) February 14, 2017 Three-pointers weren‚Äôt the only thing going for the Nuggets. They out rebounded the Warriors, 52-27, as well. As for the Warriors? The Nuggets actually stole all of Stephen Curry ‚Äôs powers as he shot an abysmal 1-of-11 from deep. If the playoffs started today, the Warriors would be the one seed and the Nuggets would be the eight seed. You can‚Äôt take too much from this matchup but it‚Äôs one we could possibly see again. The Warriors are now 46-9. So ... technically 73-9 is still in play but it looks like we won‚Äôt have another record season like last year. It‚Äôs fair to say that the Warriors-Thunder matchup on Saturday night took a lot out of everyone involved. The Thunder lost 120-98 to the Wizards and Russell Westbrook was a -36. Tough follow up for both teams. Stephen Curry agreed. Steph Curry on the loss in Denver: "We just got served a humble slice of cupcake." ‚Äî Anthony Slater (@anthonyVslater) February 14, 2017 The Nuggets also received Mason Plumlee Sunday in a trade, sending Jusuf Nurkic to the Blazers. An interesting trade as both teams are fighting for the eight seed in the Western Conference. The once surging Jazz have now lost three in a row The Jazz got two big wins against the Hawks and the Pelicans and now have lost three in a row to the Mavericks, Celtics, and Clippers . It‚Äôs been an up and down season for the Jazz and they continue to fight through injuries. Every time they seem to find their identity, the take two steps back. Luckily, the All-Star break is soon. Teams need it. Assist of the night John Wall and the Wizards destroyed the Thunder last night. This helps explain it. Dunk contest preview Look at Derrick Jones of the Phoenix Suns . He does this with such ease. Saturday night should be a real treat. .... get ready for a show. #AirplaneMode ‚úàÔ∏è pic.twitter.com/oTSEYCsLSf ‚Äî Phoenix Suns (@Suns) February 14, 2017 Scores

thread.title_full: Big Sean's "I Decided" Debuts Atop Billboard 200, Surpasses Sales Projections

posts.author: Trevor Smith
posts.title: Big Sean's "I Decided" Debuts Atop Billboard 200, Surpasses Sales Projections
posts.text:
Home > Music > Big Sean's "I Decided" Debuts Atop Billboard 200, Surpasses Sales Projections Big Sean's "I Decided" Debuts Atop Billboard 200, Surpasses Sales Projections 0 0 Posted by Trevor Smith , Feb 12, 2017 at 04:35pm Big Sean has topped projections with his fourth studio album. 
Big Sean has earned his second #1 album on the Billboard 200 with I Decided , Billboard revealed Sunday . The Detroit rapper's fourth studio album moved 151,000 equivalent album units in its first week, surpassing Billboard's original projections and making it his second consecutive solo album to top the charts. 65,000 units of the total figure are attributed to traditional album sales.The album falls slightly short of Sean's 2015 release, Dark Sky Paradise 's first week, which topped out at 173,000 equivalent album units. The album replaces Migos ' sophomore album CULTURE at the top of the Billboard 200. Last week, Migos earned their first #1 album with 131,000 in equivalent album sales. The album moved 44,000 units traditionally and 10,000 in track equivalent album units. Streaming made up for the remaining 59% of the total figure.

thread.title: Watch Beyonc√©'s Moving Grammy Acceptance Speech

posts.title: Watch Beyonc√©'s Moving Grammy Acceptance Speech
posts.text:
Preach. Photo: Kevin Winter/Getty Images After her mesmerizing Grammys performance , Beyonc√© returned to the mortal world to accept her Grammy for Best Urban Contemporary Album. Reading, of course, from a gold card that matched her outfit, Beyonc√© thanked ‚Äúeveryone who worked so hard to beautifully capture the profundity of deep Southern culture‚Äù and elaborated on the mission of Lemonade , which was to allow children to see themselves, and their beauty, reflected in her work.
Read her full remarks below:
Thank you to the Grammy voters for this incredible honor. Thank you everyone who worked so hard to beautifully capture the profundity of deep Southern culture. I thank God for my family, my wonderful husband, my beautiful daughter, my fans for bringing me so much happiness and support. 

We all experience pain and loss and often we become inaudible. My intention for the film and album was to create a body of work that will give a voice to our pain, our struggles, our darkness, and our history ‚Äì to confront issues that make us uncomfortable. 

It‚Äôs important to me to show images to my children that reflect their beauty, so they can grow up in a world where they look in the mirror ‚Äì first through their own families, as well as the news, the Super Bowl, the Olympics, the White House, and the Grammys, and see themselves, and have no doubt that they‚Äôre beautiful, intelligent, and capable. This is something I want for every child of every race, and I feel it‚Äôs vital that we learn from the past and recognize our tendencies to repeat our mistakes.

thread.title: Senators ask for info on Trump's smartphone use
thread.title_full: Senators ask for info on Trump's smartphone use

posts.author: Timothy J. Seppala
posts.title: Senators ask for info on Trump's smartphone use
posts.text:
Senators ask for info on Trump's smartphone use It's a matter of national security and maintaining presidential records. Save Bloomberg via Getty Images 
When he isn't addressing matters of national security amongst diners at his Mar-a-Lago resort , Donald Trump is reportedly using an unsecured Android phone for official communications. That's of great concern for more than a few reasons and two prominent Democrat lawmakers want the Department of Defense to address why it's happening. I look forward to hearing from @DeptofDefense about the protective measures being taken for President Trump's use of a personal smartphone pic.twitter.com/47cZeSn1bw ‚Äî Senator Tom Carper (@SenatorCarper) February 13, 2017 
Citing a plethora of news reports and a memo from the US Computer Emergency Readiness Team (PDF), Senators Tom Carper and Claire McCaskill wrote a letter to Secretary of Defense James Mattis asking for four things. First, confirmation on if Trump received a "secured, encrypted" smartphone for personal use on or before inauguration, and, if not, what kind of phone the President has been using since taking office. 
Next Carper and McCaskill want to know what kind of policies and protections the DISA (Defense Information Systems Agency) has in place for the personal phone's use. 
Further on that note, the senators want to know if the DISA, Secret Service an National Security Agency were consulted and coordinated with regarding the president's use of a personal cellphone. 
And given Trump and his team's propensity for denying things the president has said and tweeted in the past ( and then deleted , sometimes years later), Carper and McCaskill want to know if the DISA had any meetings with the National Archives and Records Administration to ensure that "all security measures allow for the preservation of any presidential records" created through Trump's use of his personal phone. 
Considering how much of a security nightmare using a phone with outdated firmware can be for average Janes and Joes, the fact that the president may be using a Samsung Galaxy S3 is deeply troubling . But hey, it's not like he (or his staff) is using a private email server , so the GOP probably won't mind. Oh, wait .

thread.title: ‚ÄòFlynn‚Äôs resignation victory for mainstream media & Democrats‚Äô ‚Äì ex-Pentagon official to RT
thread.title_full: ‚ÄòFlynn‚Äôs resignation victory for mainstream media & Democrats‚Äô ‚Äì ex-Pentagon official to RT

posts.author: RT
posts.title: ‚ÄòFlynn‚Äôs resignation victory for mainstream media & Democrats‚Äô ‚Äì ex-Pentagon official to RT
posts.text:
‚ÄòFlynn‚Äôs resignation victory for mainstream media & Democrats‚Äô ‚Äì ex-Pentagon official to RT   06:47 Get short URL Gen. Michael Flynn. ¬© Timothy A. Clary / AFP The surprise resignation of President Trump‚Äôs national security advisor, Michael Flynn, was a victory for the US mainstream media and Democrats, who were complicit in the general‚Äôs departure from the White House, a former Pentagon‚Äôs analyst told RT. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a very unfortunate development. He probably was asked to resign rather than fired,‚Äù Michael Maloof, a former senior security policy analyst for the US Secretary of Defense, told RT on Tuesday. Read more Gen. Michael Flynn resigns as National Security Advisor over contacts with Russia 
The former defense official added that Flynn‚Äôs resignation, which came following a scandal over his conversations with Russia‚Äôs ambassador to the US, Sergey Kislyak after the election, ‚Äúwas a crescendo of noise from the mainstream media, and it distracted the White House from trying to get its job done.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI think this is victory for mainstream media and for the Democrats. They don‚Äôt like this administration and they‚Äôre going to do everything they can to chip away its credibility, and this is just the beginning,‚Äù Maloof said. 
‚ÄúBoth the Democrats and the mainstream media have the anti-Russian theme, and that is the problem. And Trump himself basically said he thinks he can work with Mr. Putin, and I think it probably will go on,‚Äù he said. 
Maloof added that ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt know what was in any transcript of what was said, and the Russian ambassador reportedly denies that the issues of concern ever came up. The basic issue is ‚Äì could Flynn, who was private citizen, be even talking to Russian ambassador about sanctions being lifted,‚Äù he continued. 
‚ÄúThat comes under what we call Logan Act, a 1799 law that has never been prosecuted, and it‚Äôs crazy,‚Äù the former Pentagon official added, referring to an 18th-century law that prohibits unauthorized citizens from negotiating with foreign states in a dispute with the US. 
The Logan Act was signed into law by President John Adams in 1799 and last amended in 1994. Violations are still considered a felony and punishable by a fine or imprisonment. 
‚ÄúThe fact that a high official of the Trump administration was even talking to the Russians or wanted to improve relations, given the Democrats‚Äô mantras under Hillary Clinton during the election cycle, who was very anti-Russian in tone, and the fact that the general had paid a visit to RT anniversary and met Mr. Putin, gave them more fuel for the fire,‚Äù Maloof said in conclusion.

posts.text: Share this article Share Footage of the expletive-filled game, played in Bangor, was upload onto YouTube after seemingly being filmed by a stunned customer. Furious parents have called for the people involved in the game to be fired. The six minute video showed school staff making explicit comments about students and describing which they would like to kill. Police spoke to the workers identified in the video, but did not press any charges. Yesterday an angry crowd gathered outside a board meeting to discuss the matter. Horrified: Parents have called for the school staff to be fired after the footage was posted online Shocking: The staff members were heard discussing which students they would 'marry' and 'kill' Amanda Reprogal, the mother of a boy with special needs who was referenced in the video, told WWMT : 'I would like to see people being held accountable. 'There are some criminal charges being pressed. I‚Äôm not sure how that‚Äôs going to go, but I don‚Äôt want to see anybody lose their job, but this is not okay, you got to go.' But Bangor Police Chief Tommy Simpson said he did not see anything that charges could be issued for, telling WZZM 13 : 'There was a member of the school staff that filed a complaint because she felt threatened by the video.' But parents are calling for the school board to be recalled as they are not satisfied with the outcome. District lawyer Robert Huber said the disciplinary action will remain on file. Read more:

thread.title: "It Was A Deer In Headlights Moment": Japan Dumps Most US Treasuries Since May 2013
thread.title_full: "It Was A Deer In Headlights Moment": Japan Dumps Most US Treasuries Since May 2013

posts.author: Tyler Durden
posts.title: "It Was A Deer In Headlights Moment": Japan Dumps Most US Treasuries Since May 2013
posts.text:
"It Was A Deer In Headlights Moment": Japan Dumps Most US Treasuries Since May 2013 Feb 12, 2017 8:20 PM 0 SHARES 
With the December monthly TIC data due out this week, bond traders will be closely watching if the selling of US Treasuries by foreign accounts, and especially central banks, which as we have repeatedly shown for the past several months has hit record levels... 

... will persist, with a focus on whether China's near record selling of US paper will persist. 

However, this time the surprise may not be China, but its nemesis across the East China Sea, Japan. 
As UBS notes, Japanese investor appetite for developed market overseas bonds, and especially US, was a big story during the first seven months of 2016. However, since then interest has waned. Weekly flow data underscores how Japanese investors sold ~¬•4 trillion of overseas bonds from the time of the US presidential election to the end of Jan-17. Last week the Japanese government released more granular data for the month of December which highlights a number of notable developments. 
Most importantly, while December saw the largest overall net selling flow of overseas bonds since Jun-15, this was entirely due to offloading of US Treasuries ‚Äì other developed bond markets on aggregate actually saw modest net purchases. Indeed, while Japanese investors bought German and Australian paper, US Treasuries were sold to the tune of ~¬•2.4 trillion (~$21bn) in December, the largest net selling flow since May-13 . 
While last month (i.e. data for November) there were several factors that supported a rebound in Japanese investor demand for overseas debt (e.g., calmer market conditions, higher overseas FX-hedged yields, and supportive seasonality in Q1, a Trump honeymoon that was still in its early stages), so far there is little evidence of any bounce back in December, when yields surged across the curve, spurring widespread sales. Reuters and Bloomberg interviews with Japanese investors suggest that US political concerns and the potential for further Fed hikes are weighing on demand. Still, the potential for reallocation flows should not be overlooked, as highlighted by today's data. 
The selling has been so acute that after ignoring it for months (we first noted the record sales last September ), the relentless selling has attracted the attention of Bloomberg which writes that "the consensus is clear: few overseas investors want to step into the $13.9 trillion U.S. Treasury market right now. Whether it‚Äôs the prospect of bigger deficits and more inflation under President Donald Trump or higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve, the world‚Äôs safest debt market seems less of a sure thing -- particularly after the upswing in yields since November. And then there is Trump‚Äôs penchant for saber rattling, which has made staying home that much easier." 
[A]ny consistent drop-off in foreign demand could have lasting consequences on America‚Äôs ability to finance itself cheaply, particularly in light of Trump‚Äôs ambitious plans to boost infrastructure spending, cut taxes and put ‚ÄúAmerica First.‚Äù The president has singled out Japan and China, the two biggest overseas creditors, as well as Germany, for devaluing their currencies to gain an unfair advantage in trade. 
Whether Bloomberg is correct - especially after a brief rebound in the amount of Treasurys held in custody at the Fed in December - remains to be seen, some of the comments Bloomberg cites are worth nothing, the first of chich comes from a bond strategist at Japan's Mitsubishi UFJ: 
‚ÄúIt may be more difficult than usual for Japanese to invest in Treasuries and the dollar this year because of political uncertainty,‚Äù said Kenta Inoue, chief strategist for overseas bond investments at Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley Securities in Tokyo. ‚Äú Treasury yields may rise rapidly again in the near future, which will continue to discourage them from buying aggressively .‚Äù 
Of course, the higher the yields go, the greater the implicit demand for yields should be, however in a world where everything is one giant momentum trade, it may take a while before it emerges. 
Which is for now, other bond strategists agree with Inoue: "For now, risk-averse bond buyers like Daiwa SB Investments‚Äôs Shinji Kunibe are cutting back on Treasuries." 
Like many institutional money managers that invest abroad, Kunibe, Daiwa SB‚Äôs head of fixed-income management, likes to hedge away the risk of the dollar‚Äôs ups and downs. And right now, it makes sense. After accounting for hedging costs, 10-year Treasuries yield about 0.9 percent, roughly 10 times the return offered by Japanese government bonds. Going back to the 1980s, Treasuries have rarely enjoyed such a big edge over JGBs. However, he sees U.S. yields rising further as Trump pursues expansionary fiscal policies and takes a protectionist stance on trade. ‚ÄúYields are going to be in an uptrend,‚Äù he said. 
As Bloomberg puts it, investors like Kunibe can ill-afford more losses. Japanese demand for US paper first slid into the late summer as hedging costs - mostly in the form of swap spreads - rose... 

... last quarter, Japanese investors who hedged all their dollar exposure in Treasuries suffered a 4.7 percent loss, the biggest in at least three decades, Bloomberg reports citing data from Bank of America showed. The same thing happened in Europe, where record currency-hedged losses also stung euro-based buyers. 
‚Äú It was a deer in the headlights moment ,‚Äù said Zoltan Pozsar, a research analyst at Credit Suisse. 
While the yield pick up in recent weeks has made hedged positions profitable relative to JGBs once again, the Japanese are not rushing in. 
Combined with the unpredictability of Trump‚Äôs tweet storms, interest-rate increases in the U.S. could further sap overseas demand. Mark Dowding, who helps oversees about $50 billion as co-head of investment-grade debt at BlueBay Asset Management in London, says the firm has already moved to insulate itself from further losses due to higher rates. 

What‚Äôs more, central bankers in Japan and Europe are still experimenting with monetary policies that may benefit bond investors locally. 

Right now, it‚Äôs just ‚Äúmuch easier to stay home than go abroad,‚Äù said Shyam Rajan, Bank of America‚Äôs head of U.S. rates strategy. 
Unless, of course, the BOJ, which has been experimenting with "curve control", and nearly lost it last week, fails to maintain the long end at the desired range. Once that happens, and global bond curves become unhinged leading to a worldwide dumping of duration, it may be time to head for the exits.

thread.title: EXCLUSIVE: Keith Urban Dishes on Plans for Nicole Kidman's 50th Birthday
thread.title_full: EXCLUSIVE: Keith Urban Dishes on Plans for Nicole Kidman's 50th Birthday

posts.author: Jennifer Drysdale
posts.title: EXCLUSIVE: Keith Urban Dishes on Plans for Nicole Kidman's 50th Birthday
posts.text: EXCLUSIVE: Keith Urban Dishes on Plans for Nicole Kidman's 50th Birthday by Jennifer Drysdale 8:21   Playing EXCLUSIVE: Keith Urban Dishes on Plans for Nicole Kidman's 50th Birthday Keith Urban has something in the works for Nicole Kidman's birthday. ET's Cameron Mathison caught up with the singer at the GRAMMYs in Los Angeles on Sunday, and though his wife was across the pond at the BAFTAs, he knew better than to reveal his big plans for Kidman's special day. EXCLUSIVE: Carrie Underwood Hoping to Go on Hockey Date With Keith Urban and Nicole Kidman "I'm planning stuff right now that I can't talk about!" he confessed. "I feel incredibly lucky and blessed, definitely." Kidman will turn 50 in June, and Urban just a few months later, making 2017 "a big year all around." So big, in fact, that Urban can't even reveal his Valentine's Day surprises. "I gotta keep it a secret!" he said. Whatever Urban has planned, Kidman is definitely in for a treat. The country singer sweetly shared the inspiration for his duet with Carrie Underwood, "The Fighter" (which they performed at the GRAMMYs), revealing that he tries to protect Kidman "every day." WATCH: Keith Urban and Carrie Underwood Tease Boxing Ring Bout in Music Video for ‚ÄòThe Fighter‚Äô Duet "It's a song about protecting the one you love, so that they don't have to take the blows of the world, and can stay pure," he dished. "I always think that when people go, 'Oh, I'm very thick-skinned,' I always feel like saying, 'I'm so sorry.' It's not really a great attribute to be thick-skinned, it's kind of nice when someone can take the blows for the one you love. That's what the song's about," he continued. "I try [to do that for my wife] every day." As for whether Kidman will be his next duet partner, the country star says to stay tuned. "We're so spontaneous, everything is just always in the moment," he said. "So we'll see what happens!"

posts.text:
"Droga, sesso e violenze in Ateneo a Bologna". Parla la tirocinante minacciata per aver denunciato Corriere della Sera E-mail Commento 
‚ÄúSiringhe in bagno, spaccio e furti agli studenti. Oltre ai punkabbestia poi sono comparsi i collettivi anarchici: risse, minacce e insulti erano all‚Äôordine del giorno‚Äù. √à la descrizione che Emilia Garuti, studentessa dell‚ÄôUniversit√† di Bologna e tirocinante della biblioteca dell‚ÄôAteneo, fa degli spazi teatro nei giorni scontri degli scontri tra collettivi studenteschi e forze dell‚Äôordine. Intervistata dal Corriere della Sera , Emilia racconta il degrado a cui √® stata ridotta la biblioteca: 
‚Äú√à successo anche questo: un giorno un tizio si √® masturbato davanti a una ragazza, all‚Äôinterno della biblioteca, come se niente fosse. Lei √® scappata fuori in lacrime mentre dentro scoppiava un pandemonio. Un‚Äôaltra volta ho avvertito una ragazza che la stavano derubando: sono stata inseguita e minacciata di botte‚Äù. 
Emilia spiega come la situazione √® degenerata nel corso del tempo: 
‚ÄúLa biblioteca nel corso degli anni ha prolungato i suoi orari, prima oltre le 17, poi fino alle 24. Uno sforzo compiuto proprio per garantire a tutti la possibilit√† di studiare. Ma dal pomeriggio il personale se ne va, restano solo i custodi. E in quelle ore le stanze diventano terra di nessuno. O meglio: hanno cominciato a entrare i punkabbestia e gli altri gruppi che stazionano nella piazza l√¨ davanti, facendo i loro comodi‚Äù. 
Poi, oltre ai punkabbestia, sono comparsi i collettivi anarchici. Cos√¨, prosegue Emilia, ‚Äúsono cominciate le occupazioni, le assemblee, le risse tra gruppi rivali; minacce e insulti erano all‚Äôordine del giorno. Un inferno‚Äù. 
Il resto √® cronaca di questi giorni, come ricorda il Corsera: 
‚ÄúIl culmine viene raggiunto quando l‚Äôateneo bolognese si convince a installare dei tornelli all‚Äôingresso della biblioteca: chi entra, deve avere un badge. √à cronaca dei giorni scorsi: prima gli antagonisti decidono di sabotare i dispositivi all‚Äôingresso, poi li smontano e occupano la biblioteca. A quel punto il rettore chiama la polizia e fa sgomberare i locali con la forza‚Äù. Altro:

posts.title: QUANDO LE PATATE HANNO MEMORIA ‚Äì BATTISTA: OGGI TUTTI AD INDIGNARSI PER LE ALLUSIONI SULLA RAGGI, COM‚ÄôE‚Äô CHE NESSUNO FECE ALTRETTANTO QUANDO SABINA GUZZATI NON UTILIZZO‚Äô GIRI DI PAROLE SULLA CARFAGNA? BERCIO‚Äô FORMULE DA OSTERIA E DA CASERMA DA UN PALCO CON BEPPE GRILLO: INDIGNAZIONE A COMANDO‚Ä¶
posts.text:
Pierluigi Battista per il Corriere della Sera Allora, a proposito di volgarit√†, oscenit√†, sessismo, bullismo, ecco il ricordo di un episodio che dimostra quanto la violenza verbale sia trasversale e ben distribuita, e quanto spesso l' indignazione sia un sentimento volubile, che si accende e si spegne a seconda non delle convinzioni, ma delle convenienze. L' episodio si svolge sul palco di una manifestazione contro Berlusconi del luglio del 2008, guidata da Beppe Grillo e da Antonio Di Pietro. La piazza sempre indignata risuona di ululati di approvazione quando Sabina Guzzanti, dopo aver maltrattato l' allora presidente Napolitano e l' allora pontefice Ratzinger, decide di vomitare sull' allora ministro delle Pari opportunit√† Mara Carfagna espressioni avvilenti per tutte le donne e per tutti gli uomini, piene di allusioni grevi e riferimenti espliciti che si fa fatica a pubblicare integralmente: ¬´Berlusconi, tu non puoi mettere alle Pari opportunit√† una che sta l√¨ perch√©¬ª e via con l' insinuazione volgare; ¬´osteria delle ministre, le ministre son maestre, e se a letto son portento, figuriamoci in Parlamento¬ª: ¬´Berlusconi il giorno del giuramento dei ministri potr√† dire "pari opportunit√†"¬ª e via con giochetti verbali che si sarebbero definiti da caserma. 
RAGGI E cos√¨ via berciando. Da notare. Uno: che la platea di intellettuali gravati dal fardello della superiorit√† morale non solo non deplor√≤ la melma sessista fuoriuscita da quel palco, ma la applaud√¨ estasiata. 
mara carfagna (2) Due: che quel festival osceno aveva preso spunto da presunte intercettazioni ¬´calde¬ª tra Mara Carfagna e un' altra ministra, intercettazioni di cui non si √® mai registrata traccia, esempio di come le vituperate fake news non siano una novit√†, anche se distribuite dai giornali autorizzati e vidimati dal ministero della Verit√†. 
sabina guzzanti Tre: che le reazioni a sinistra e nelle istituzioni furono molto blande, con l' eccezione dell' allora segretario del Pd Walter Veltroni che colse l' occasione per rompere l' alleanza elettorale (incautamente) stretta con Di Pietro. Quattro: che Mara Carfagna ha vinto una causa con Sabina Guzzanti e che, malgrado abbia dimostrato di essere una donna preparata e scrupolosa, sia ancora raggiunta da maldicenze diffuse dai sepolcri imbiancati e legate alla sua bellezza e al suo passato di soubrette televisiva. Cinque: mai fidarsi dei professionisti dell' indignazione a comando.

thread.title: Cheltenham Festival brings in four alcoholic drinks rule - BBC News
thread.title_full: Cheltenham Festival brings in four alcoholic drinks rule - BBC News

posts.title: Cheltenham Festival brings in four alcoholic drinks rule - BBC News
posts.text:
Cheltenham Festival brings in four alcoholic drinks rule 13 February 2017 Close share panel Image copyright Getty Images Image caption Organisers say they want people to come to the festival to enjoy the racing Cheltenham Festival racegoers will be restricted to buying four alcoholic drinks at a time in a bid to crack down on anti-social antics. 
Two footballers apologised after being photographed apparently urinating into a glass at last year's festival, where women were seen baring their breasts. 
Chief executive Ian Renton said: "It's to ensure that drinking is not the rationale for people coming racing." 
The measure is also to be imposed at the Jockey Club's other racecourses. 
It comes in first at Cheltenham, where the festival takes place next month, but will be in place at Epsom, which stages the Derby, and Aintree, where the Grand National is held. 
"It's an improvement on things we are already doing," Mr Renton said. 
"Aintree has already got the ball rolling, with their Ladies' Day, they've already taken steps to improve the way that is perceived. 
"We want them to come to racing and enjoy the sport and not have those people coming who will be a nuisance to other racegoers," added Mr Renton. 
As well as the four-drink limit, corporate complimentary bars will close earlier and water points will be made available in every public bar.

thread.title: Dekat Istana Bogor ada SD ambruk, kerugian ratusan juta rupiah
thread.title_full: Dekat Istana Bogor ada SD ambruk, kerugian ratusan juta rupiah

posts.author: editor@merdeka.com (Editor)
posts.title: Dekat Istana Bogor ada SD ambruk, kerugian ratusan juta rupiah
posts.text:
Dekat Istana Bogor ada SD ambruk, kerugian ratusan juta rupiah   05:01 Reporter : Ilham Kusmayadi Sekolah ambruk di Bogor. ¬©2017 Merdeka.com 
Merdeka.com - Dua unit ruang kelas perpustakaan dan praktikum komputer SDN Pakuan, Kompleks Pakuan 2, Kelurahan Pakuan, Bogor Selatan, Kota Bogor, ambruk pada pukul 09.00 WIB, Minggu (12/02). Tak ada korban jiwa, namun kerugian ditaksir mencapai ratusan juta rupiah.Ketua Komisi D DPRD Kota Bogor, Adityawarman Adil yang mengetahui kejadian itu, menyayangkan adanya kejadian ruangan sekolah yang ambruk dan letaknya di perkotaan. Karena dari keterangan Dinas Pendidikan (Disdik) Kota Bogor masih ada bangunan sekolah dari zaman impres dahulu, jadi bangunan usianya sudah lumayan lama."Kalau informasi yang didapat Disdik Kota Bogor ada 20 persen bangunan sekolah yang sudah usianya tua. SD Pakuan merupakan salah satunya bangunan yang sudah lama, tapi pada tahun 2017 tidak ada pembangunan baru dan hanya revitalisasi saja," ujar Adityawarman di Bogor. Sekolah ambruk di Bogor 2017 Merdeka.com 
Menurut Adityawarman, untuk revitalisasi bisa dilakukan melalui Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) dari berbagai perusahaan yang ada di Kota Bogor atau sekitar sekolah. Itu dilakukan kalau dalam APBD 2017 tidak bisa dianggarkan, untuk SD Pakuan ini, pihaknya akan memeriksa terlebih dahulu kondisi kerusakannya."Pendidikan dan kesehatan hal yang penting, tapi kenapa Pemkot Bogor tidak mengutamakan sarana dan prasarana pendidikan. Kalau sarana dan prasarananya tidak mendukung bagaimana pendidikan bisa maju, harus jadi prioritas pembangunan dibanding pedestrian dan taman. Jangan dilupakan SD di pinggiran juga yang lebih utama, besok saya akan cek SD Pakuan," tegasnya.Adityawarman menambahkan pihak Dinas Pendidikan Kota Bogor wajib bertanggungjawab penuh atas ambruknya dua ruang SDN yang memang bangunannya sudah tua dan rawan ambruk itu. Informasi diperoleh menyebutkan, robohnya bangunan sekolah yang letaknya hanya 3 kilometer dari Istana Kepresidenan dan Balai Kota Bogor itu diduga karena kayu atap bangunan sudah rapuh dimakan rayap dan usia."Memang benar ada sekolah ambruk. Tapi sebaiknya untuk lebih lengkap silakan hubungi Dinas Pendidikan (Disdik) Kota Bogor," ujar Kepala Badan Penanggulangan Bencana Daerah (BPBD) Ganjar Gunawan saat dihubungi, Minggu (12/02).Sementara itu, Camat Bogor Selatan, Sujatmiko Baliarto membenarkan ambruknya dua ruang SDN Pakuan Kota Bogor itu kondisinya memang sudah rusak, selain karena faktor usia bangunan juga karena hampir seluruh kayu yang dijadikan atap lapuk dimakan rayap."Akibat kejadian buku-buku, perlengkapan juga peralatan yang ada di ruang perpustakaan rusak tertimpa material bangunan. Saat ini sedang dilakukan penanganan pembersihan material dan pemindahan buku-buku dan peralatan ke lokasi aman. Serta dilakukan juga pemasangan terpal di atap ruangan yg ambruk," ungkap Sujatmiko, Minggu (12/02). [ded]

thread.title: Flynn sidelined by broken rib in barn accident
thread.title_full: Flynn sidelined by broken rib in barn accident

posts.author: Jeffrey Flanagan
posts.title: Flynn sidelined by broken rib in barn accident
posts.text:
Flynn sidelined by broken rib in barn accident Flynn gets out of jam 0:10 Brian Flynn gets Max Kepler to ground out into a fielders choice, leaving the bases loaded to end the top of the 7th inning By Jeffrey Flanagan / MLB.com | + 0 COMMENTS 
SURPRISE, Ariz. -- Left-hander Brian Flynn , a candidate to possibly make the Royals' bullpen, will miss at least eight weeks after sustaining a broken rib while falling through the roof of a barn at his home. 
Royals manager Ned Yost confirmed the injury after Tuesday's workout. Flynn, 26, was doing some work at his home in McAlester, Okla., when the accident occurred. 
"He was working on his barn and fell through the roof," Yost said. "So he took a pretty good tumble, knocked himself out. He's going to be eight weeks behind everyone else." 
‚Ä¢ Royals' bullpen doesn't have shortage of arms 
Flynn, who is out of options, also sustained three non-displaced fractures in his vertebrae. Flynn could be a candidate to start the season on the disabled list. 
Flynn had a 2.60 ERA in 36 appearances last season and would have been in stiff competition for a roster spot this spring. has covered the Royals since 1991, and for MLB.com since 2015. Follow him on Twitter @FlannyMLB .

Plus d'un millier de personnes ce matin dans les rues de Loudun pour exiger le maintien du SMUR de l'h√¥pital de la ville, menac√© de fermeture. 
Par C.H  11 Mis √† jour le 14/02/2017 √† 11:13 De nombreux √©lus en t√™te de cort√®ge, des personnels du Centre Hospitalier de Loudun et des habitants, plus d'un millier de personnes a d√©fil√© dans les rues de la ville pour exiger le maintien du SMUR (service mobile d'urgence et de r√©animation) dans leur h√¥pital. Les √©lus en t√™te de cort√®ge de la manifestation pour le maintien du SMUR de Loudun. / Sandrine Lecl√®re La manifestation √©tait organis√© par les syndicats CGT et CFDT de l'h√¥pital Nord-Vienne, regroupant les √©tablissements de Loudun et Ch√¢tellerault. Les syndicalistes craignent que la fermeture du SMUR ne soit qu'une premi√®re √©tape annon√ßant des restrictions encore plus importantes. Le Groupement des H√¥pitaux du Nord-Vienne (GHNV) conna√Æt un d√©ficit financier de 3,7 millions d'euros et la fermeture du SMUR de Loudun fait partie des mesures d'√©conomie envisag√©e pour r√©duire ce d√©ficit. #loudun manif dans le centre-ville pour le maintien du SMUR 24/24 pic.twitter.com/xE0FOl7fPi ‚Äî Sandrine Leclere (@SandrineLeclere) 14 f√©vrier 2017 Vers un maintien du SMUR en journ√©e ? La direction de l'h√¥pital de Loudun envisage de supprimer le service du SMUR de Loudun en faisant assurer ses 240 sorties annuelles par les SMUR de Poitiers, Ch√¢tellerault et Thouars. Au terme de ces discussions, une avanc√©e semble se dessiner avec le maintien du SMUR en journ√©e mais les syndicats demandent une assurance √©crite de la part de l'ARS (Agence R√©gionale de Sant√©) et exigent surtout le maintien du service 24h/24h avec l'engagement d'un deuxi√®me m√©decin urgentsite sur l'h√¥pital.

thread.title: Cops: Injured inmate fell in the toilet, not beaten
thread.title_full: Cops: Injured inmate fell in the toilet, not beaten

posts.title: Cops: Injured inmate fell in the toilet, not beaten
posts.text:
More 
The injuries sustained by prisoner Chandran Muniandy are due to a fall, and not due to beatings, Penang police said today. 
The Star Online quoted South Seberang Prai police chief Supt Shafee Abdul Samad as saying that the 42-year-old inmate had fallen in the toilet, injuring his head, while his ‚Äúmissing‚Äù toenails were because they were removed in the prison clinic due to a skin disease. 
He further dismissed claims of abuse behind bars and said Chandran was a psychiatric patient. 
Chandran‚Äôs mother Pachaee Pakiry, 58, had made a police report on Saturday, alleging her odd-job worker son was beaten up in prison. 
She had said that he was healthy when he went into prison on Jan 20 after being sentenced to six months in jail for causing hurt with a dangerous weapon. She also questioned how he had landed in the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the Seberang Jaya hospital last Wednesday with a head injury and missing toenails. 
Penang Deputy Chief Minister II P Ramasamy had also urged the authorities to look into the matter as the injuries did not seem to have been self-inflicted. 
The portal also quoted Penang prisons director SAC Kamarudzaman Mamat as saying that Chandran was undergoing psychiatric evaluation, and was in solitary confinement due to mental instability. 
‚ÄúThere was no way he could have been beaten by other prisoners or warders as he was not in contact with any of them during the solitary confinement and evaluation.‚Äù 
Kamarudzaman had said that they have also started a domestic inquiry into the matter, besides the police investigation. 
Chandran‚Äôs case comes just days after the custodial death of detainee S Balamurugan at the North Klang district police headquarters on Feb 8.
