thread.title: Etan Patz murder suspect Pedro Hernandez found guilty in killing
thread.title_full: Etan Patz murder suspect Pedro Hernandez found guilty in killing - NY Daily News

posts.author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
posts.title: Etan Patz murder suspect Pedro Hernandez found guilty in killing
posts.text:
After nearly 40 years and two trials, the parents of Etan Patz finally got justice for the murder of their 6-year-old son.
A jury found Pedro Hernandez guilty of luring the child into the basement of a SoHo bodega in 1979 and strangling him.
The panel of eight men and four women only took nine days to reach a verdict.
The previous jury was deadlocked after 18 days of deliberations due to one holdout juror who refused to convict Hernandez.
Defense argues at retrial that former suspect killed Etan Patz 
Prosecutors prevailed despite tougher odds.
Hernandez‚Äôs attorneys were able to use testimony from the previous trial against witnesses taking the stand for a second time.
Etan Patz‚Äôs disappearance in 1979 was a national phenomenon. (¬© Keith Bedford / Reuters/REUTERS) The central facts of the case remained the same. Since Etan's body was never found and there were no witnesses to his abduction, the verdict revolved around Hernandez‚Äôs confession and the circumstances of the child‚Äôs disappearance.
There were some subtle differences in the retrial, however.
Jury has mulled charges for accused Etan Patz killer for 5 days 
The defense chose not to call to the stand two jailhouse informants who obtained confessions from a different suspect in the killing, Jose Ramos.
Nor did the defense call a federal prosecutor, Stuart GraBois, who pursued Ramos for years.
The decision was a strategic one. The defense attacked the reliability of Hernandez's confession and pursued an alternate suspect defense ‚Äî still pointing the finger at Ramos.
16 photos view gallery Etan Patz case The witnesses they declined to call to support the Ramos theory were not necessary, they felt, and would have been hounded on cross-examination.
Etan Patz killer staked out boy before killing him: prosecutors 
But Hernandez‚Äôs confession remained the main hurdle for the defense.
In disturbing detail, the defendant admitted luring the little boy to the bodega where he worked at West Broadway and Prince St. in SoHo.
The child was walking alone for the first time to his school bus stop at the same corner.
The 38-year-old case caused a national furor at the time, and became a permanent part of the city's psyche. Etan became one of the first missing children to be pictured on milk cartons.
Attorneys for Pedro Hernandez said he was mentally ill and suffered from delusions that lead him to falsely believe he killed Etan Patz. (Louis Lanzano/ASSOCIATED PRESS) No one went to trial until Hernandez confessed.
Lawyers for Hernandez argued the damning admissions were the result of a seven-hour police interrogation that cops did not record.
They said Hernandez‚Äôs mental illness and history of delusions lead him to falsely believe he was responsible.
Hernandez has an IQ of just 70 and a mental disorder similar to schizophrenia.
Some of the 11 jurors who had wanted to convicted Hernandez during the first trial attended portions of the redo trial, including summations. They also consulted with prosecutors as they re-framed their case.
Etan‚Äôs father, Stanley Patz, attended each day of both trials. (Alec Tabak/for New York Daily News) The lone holdout juror, Adam Sirois, gave pointers to the defense.
As the new jury began deliberation Sirois said he remained certain he‚Äôd reached the right verdict.
"I sleep fine at night. I feel like I did the right thing. My conscious is clear,‚Äù he said.
Hernandez‚Äôs confession was not credible, he added.
"I feel it was a statement made under duress and by a man who has severe mental health issues, low intelligence, poor memory,‚Äù he said.
Tags: etan patz new york murders crimes against children

The Kardashian clan is known for giving extravagant gifts . Why, just this past Christmas, Kris Jenner gave KhloƒÇ≈† Kardashian √Ç rare√Ç photos of Marilyn Monroe , KhloƒÇ≈† gave boyfriend√Ç Tristan Thompson √Ç a diamond-crusted Patek Philippe watch and a Lorraine Schwartz bracelet √Ç √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù and Kylie Jenner gave Thunderbirds to her grandmother, M.J., and her mom .
But it‚Äôs not just the adult Kardashians who get in on the gifting action. The√Ç littlest members of the close-knit family are all about it too √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù just ask√Ç Chrissy Teigen !
On Monday, the 31-year-old√Ç Sports Illustrated Swimsuit model √Ç showed off a new pair of Yeezys √Ç her 10-month-old daughter Luna √Ç received from√Ç Kim Kardashian West √Ç and Kanye West ‚Äòs kids North , 3, and Saint , 1 √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù in honor of Valentine‚Äôs Day.
The present√Ç came with a sweet note addressed to Luna, that read, ‚ÄúHappy Valentin‚Äôe Day beautiful baby girl! Lots of love, North and Saint.‚Äù

‚ÄúOh my gosh, Kim and Kanye √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù my baby is doper than me. My baby is cooler than me!,‚Äù Teigen gushed as she showed off the black kicks for the camera.
‚ÄúLook what you got?‚Äù she told Luna, as the sweet girl grabbed her new footwear.
Luna appeared happy with her gift, smiling for the camera. But Teigen explained it had been a tough morning for her and husband John Legend ‚Äòs daughter. ‚ÄúMaybe this will help today‚Äôs crankiness,‚Äù she wrote √¢‚Ç¨‚Äù telling Luna ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt be sad anymore! Don‚Äôt be sad!‚Äù
It looked to work, with Luna blowing kisses for the camera (with the help of one of Snapchat‚Äôs Valentine‚Äôs Day filters).
after 3 months of trying to get her to blow kisses, she finally does it for the valentine's snap ahhhh pic.twitter.com/hR21tOOPfQ

Later on Twitter, Teigen explained that the Kardashians are the tops when it comes to giving presents.
‚ÄúNOBODY gifts better than this entire family,‚Äù she told a fan. ‚ÄúI swear, @krisjenner goes HAM.‚Äù

Teigen had a rough Monday , recovering from a massive hangover after a night√Ç of partying a little too hard at the 2017 Grammy Awards .
‚ÄúI don‚Äôt feel good,‚Äù she wrote on Twitter .
In a series of hilarious√Ç Snapchats taken late on Sunday night √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú following the Los Angeles ceremony during which√Ç Legend performed √Ç √¢‚Ç¨‚Äú the model appeared to be a little out of it, asking for an assist while attempting to remove her stunning jewelry.
√¢‚Ç¨≈ìOkay, I√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢m home. We√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢re having ramen,√¢‚Ç¨¬ù she declared in the first video, showing off her silky, orange outfit change.
By the next update, though, Teigen was laying down.
√¢‚Ç¨≈ìI√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢m on the floor and John√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢s in charge of taking my jewelry off for [ stylist Monica Rose ]. Take it off John,√¢‚Ç¨¬ù she said.

posts.text:
BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump‚Äôs outburst BAFTAS 2017: Hugh Grant sides with Meryl Streep against President Donald Trump‚Äôs outburst HUGH GRANT has hit back at US President Donald Trump in support of his fellow film star Meryl Streep. PUBLISHED: 21:37,  56, Sun, Feb 12, 2017 GETTY Hugh Grant has defended Meryl Streep against Donald Trump's comments 
Slamming Trump‚Äôs comments in which the president branded Streep ‚Äúone of the most overrated actresses in Hollywood‚Äù , Grant said he disagreed with the remarks. 
Referring to Donald Trump ‚Äôs cameo in the film Two Weeks Notice, Grant said: ‚ÄúNo, I disagree with my other co-star Donald Trump. 
‚ÄúIt‚Äôs like watching Leonardo Da Vinci paint or something. She is just really, really good. I would say sort of possessed by the role, so almost like something from the exorcist.‚Äù Related articles BAFTAs 2017: Meryl Streep 'overrated'! Stephen Fry echoes Trump dig 
The 56-year-old actor also revealed at the BAFTAs that he is terrified and frightened when filming with Streep because of her professional acting skills. 
‚ÄúOf course, especially the big emotional scenes. I‚Äôm frightened of those anyway, you know, the greatest actress in the country,‚Äù he added. 
The support came after 70-year-old Trump unleashed a series of tweets before his inauguration, attacking 67-year-old Streep in response to her criticism of him at the Golden Globes. GETTY Hugh Grant and Meryl Streep starred together in Florence Foster Jenkins GETTY Hugh Grant has defended Meryl Streep at the BAFTAs 2017 BAFTAs 2017: The award winners Sun, February 12, 2017

thread.title: Grammys 2017: How a US-Based Hat Company Stole the Show | Fox Business
thread.title_full: Grammys 2017: How a US-Based Hat Company Stole the Show | Fox Business

posts.author: Thomas Barrabi
posts.title: Grammys 2017: How a US-Based Hat Company Stole the Show | Fox Business
posts.text:
Print 
( Associated Press ) 
The world‚Äôs top musicians took home plenty of hardware at the 2017 Grammy Awards on Sunday, but Buffalo-based hat manufacturer New Era was one of the night‚Äôs surprise winners. 
Continue Reading Below 
Chance The Rapper wore a New Era-made baseball hat on the red carpet and throughout the event at the Staples Center in Los Angeles. The hat, emblazoned with Chance‚Äôs trademark ‚Äú#3‚Äù and adorned with a New Era sticker and logo, generated $2.53 million in equivalent advertising value for the privately-held company, according to calculations by Apex Marketing Group. 
New Era has manufactured and sold hats through an exclusive deal with the Chicago-based performer since last October. Chance, whose real name is Chancellor Johnathan Bennett, took home three awards, including Best New Artist, Best Rap Performance and Best Rap Album. His personal ‚Äú#3‚Äù brand ‚Äì meant to commemorate his award-winning third mixtape ‚Äì earned $7.26 million in equivalent ad value during CBS‚Äô broadcast, according to Apex. More on this... At Super Bowl, the Gatorade Bath is Marketing Gold 
The headwear brand did not immediately respond to FOX Business‚Äô request for comment. Best known as one of the premier hat manufacturers in the sports world, New Era has partnerships with the NFL, MLB and NBA, and it has held naming rights for the NFL‚Äôs Buffalo Bills‚Äô home stadium since August 2016. 
New Era wasn‚Äôt the only brand to benefit from a celebrity‚Äôs wardrobe choices at the Grammys. Apex says singer Ed Sheeran generated $990,000 in ad value for Hoax, a British clothing company, when he wore the brand‚Äôs T-shirt during his performance. 
Aside from his deal with New Era, Chance The Rapper appeared in commercials for Nike ( NKE ) and the Kit-Kat candy brand. What do you think?

thread.title: D.C. United 2017 MLS season preview: Roster, schedule, national TV info and more
thread.title_full: D.C. United 2017 MLS season preview: Roster, schedule, national TV info and more

posts.title: D.C. United 2017 MLS season preview: Roster, schedule, national TV info and more
posts.text:
29 PM Ben Olsen's side will look to build off a strong second half of 2016 after an offseason focused on locking down key players and adding depth.   
In terms of midseason overhauls, the 2016 MLS campaign will be defined by the Seattle Sounders' worst-to-first surge. But don't forget that RFK Stadium played host to quite the reinvention as well. 
As July came to a close, D.C. United found itself sitting eighth in the East while   game. Then came the offensive fireworks ‚Äî a remarkable 33 goals in 13 matches as United ended the year on a 6-2-5 run. 
  lays groundwork for a new era 
The summer acquisitions of Patrick Mullins and Lloyd Sam coincided with an upturn in form from playmaker Luciano Acosta, who embraced a new 4-1-4-1 formation. After an all-too-short playoff run, United is hungry to build off that strong second half of 2016 and prove the surge was no flash in the pan. 
While the offseason additions were limited, United returns Ben Olsen's entire first-choice XI. If Acosta and Mullins continue to develop while the likes of Bill Hamid and Steve Birnbaum keep things tidy in the back, United can be a contender in 2017 ‚Äî and beyond. How did D.C. United perform in 2016? 
2016 finish: Fourth in Eastern Conference (11-10-13), eliminated in Eastern Conference knockout round 
United overcame that sluggish first half of 2016 to not only make the playoffs for the third straight year but earn a home game in the knockout round as well. But Laurent Ciman's early goal stunned the RFK Stadium faithful, and the Montreal Impact cruised to a 4-2 win to put an abrupt end to United's impressive run. D.C. United's key offseason losses 
United's core remains intact, though a handful of role players did exit this winter. The most notable loss is retired striker Alvaro Saborio , who scored a respectable six goals in 19 games last season but logged just 94 minutes after losing his starting spot to Mullins in mid-July. 
The club also parted ways with seldom-used reserves Andrew Dykstra , Luke Mishu , Miguel Aguilar , Collin Martin and Kennedy Igboananike . D.C. United's key offseason additions 
It was a fairly quiet offseason, with United mostly focused on making Acosta's loan a permanent move and inking Birnbaum to a new deal. But the signing of homegrown player Ian Harkes ‚Äî the reigning Hermann Trophy winner and son of United legend John Harkes ‚Äî looms large. 
The front office also bolstered the club's depth. Costa Rica international Jose Guillermo Ortiz looks poised to fill Saborio's void, while MLS journeyman Sebastien Le Toux should provide a dependable locker room presence. Although right back wasn't a position of need, United was pleased to see Maryland product Chris Odoi-Atsem drop to No. 12 in the MLS draft. How will D.C. United line up in 2017? 
For now, expect the back line of Sean Franklin, Birnbaum, Bobby Boswell and Taylor Kemp to remain intact. But Nick DeLeon is pushing for minutes at right back after impressing there late last season, and Franklin has been getting looks at center back during preseason. 
Now 35 years old, Marcelo Sarvas will battle with Rob Vincent for the deep-lying playmaker role. Harkes, Jared Jeffrey and Julian Buescher, meanwhile, are pushing for minutes at the advanced central midfield slot alongside Acosta. 
Reduced to a bench role down the stretch in 2016, Lamar Neagle quietly led United with nine goals. Look for Neagle or Patrick Nyarko to start on the left, with Le Toux serving as depth behind Sam on the right. And Ortiz could be a factor in a number of attacking midfield roles, in addition to backing up Mullins up top. Full D.C. United roster entering the 2017 season 
Goalkeepers : Bill Hamid, Eric Klenofsky, Travis Worra 
Defenders : Steve Birnbaum, Bobby Boswell, Nick DeLeon, Sean Franklin, Taylor Kemp, Chris Odoi-Atsem, Kofi Opare, Jalen Robinson 
Midfielders : Luciano Acosta, Julian Buescher, Chris Durkin, Ian Harkes, Jared Jeffrey, Sebastien Le Toux, Lamar Neagle, Patrick Nyarko, Lloyd Sam, Marcelo Sarvas, Rob Vincent 
Forwards : Alhaji Kamara, Patrick Mullins, Jose Guillermo Ortiz, Chris Rolfe D.C. United's national TV schedule 
D.C. United vs. New York City FC - Saturday, April 8, at 4 p.m. ET on UniMas Atlanta United vs. D.C. United - Sunday, April 30, at 3 p.m. ET on FS1 D.C. United vs. Montreal Impact - Saturday, May 6, at 6 p.m. ET on TSN Chicago Fire vs. D.C. United - Saturday, May 20, at 4 p.m. ET on UniMas Vancouver Whitecaps vs. D.C. United - Saturday, May 27, at 7 p.m. ET on TSN Toronto FC vs. D.C. United - Saturday, June 17, at 7:30 p.m. ET on TSN Montreal Impact vs. D.C. United - Saturday, July 1, at p.m. ET on TSN D.C. United vs. Toronto FC - Saturday, Aug. 5, at 7 p.m. ET on TSN Related

thread.title: These Kolkata companies exist only to turn black money into white
thread.title_full: These Kolkata companies exist only to turn black money into white - The Economic Times

posts.author: Kiran Kabtta Somvanshi
posts.title: These Kolkata companies exist only to turn black money into white
posts.text:
ET INTELLIGENCE GROUP: With the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office setting up a task force late last week to monitor action against deviant shell companies after the February 1 Budget tightened rules against such entities, Kolkata may well bear the brunt of the clampdown. The city tops the search for most companies registered at the same address. 

This is the location that heads the list ‚Äî 9/12, Lal Bazar Street, with 315 companies. It just happens to be the address of the city‚Äôs police headquarters as well. Registered Companies, an analytics firm specialising in corporate due diligence, crunched through data from the Ministry of Corporate Affairs and found that 1,410 companies are registered in different blocks of the 9/12 Lal Bazar Street area with 84 of them based in Room No. 10 in one block. The area is a warren of chartered accountants‚Äô offices with most of the companies being private limited ones engaged in wholesale trading and real estate. 

A little over 11,281 firms are registered at 148 addresses, an average of 76 each. Seven of the top 10 most common addresses are in Kolkata. Apart from the one above, these are 52, Weston Street; 5, Gorky Terrace; 266, Dakshindari Road; 91, Shakespeare Sarani, and 4/A, Palit Street. 



To be sure, there is no limit on companies that can be registered at the same address. Consultants typically house the registered offices of companies for which they handle compliances, a practice common in Singapore and Mauritius as well, said Vinod Kothari, a company law practitioner based in Kolkata. A company secretary firm in Singapore will be home to the registered offices of hundreds of companies, typically called ‚Äòletter box companies‚Äô. 

But a corporate affairs ministry official said many of them exist only to turn black into white. 

‚ÄúSome of these are surely shell companies ‚Äî created for laundering of unaccounted cash,‚Äù the person said. 

‚ÄúSome may also be incorporated for the purpose of selling off at a later stage to parties who want to acquire up-and-running firms rather than incorporate new ones. The ministry, Serious Fraud Investigation Office and income-tax department are aware of these practices and action is being taken.‚Äù 

The Institute of Chartered Accountants of India said it‚Äôs determined to discipline erring members. 

Any misconduct that abets corruption and money laundering will be investigated and punished if proven, the institute told ET. 

‚ÄúMost of these companies typically have small paid-up capital and high general reserves,‚Äù said a Kolkata-based independent financial adviser. 

According to people with knowledge of the matter, the system involves seasoned accountants and money market brokers bringing together two sets of people ‚Äî those with unaccounted cash and those needing it. 

The shell companies belong to the latter group and have big amounts as ‚Äòcash on hand‚Äô but actually hold little of it as it‚Äôs been used in ways that can‚Äôt be accounted for. They have mostly spent their earnings and fund withdrawals from banks for personal use, bribes and commissions. 

‚ÄòKOLKATA HAS BEEN NOTORIOUS‚Äô 

‚ÄúKolkata has been very notorious for shell companies being used for money laundering, especially penny stocks being used to create long-term capital gains that are exempt from tax, a loophole that was plugged in this year‚Äôs Budget,‚Äù said Amit Maheshwari, partner, Ashok Maheshwary & Associates LLP. ‚ÄúGiven the complexity of the transactions and the accounting involved, it won‚Äôt be easy for individuals to swiftly cover up the trail of black money .‚Äù 

As a natural corollary, email IDs are also common for many companies. For instance, ‚Äúinvestor@srsr.in‚Äù is the corporate email ID for 213 companies. This address, ‚Äúgroup.dsc.group@gmail.com‚Äù, is the director‚Äôs email ID at 206 companies. Of about 1.5 million registered companies, only 600,000 file annual returns, the PMO said. 

Shell companies are characterised by nominal paid-up capital, high reserves and surpluses on account of receipts of high share premiums, investment in unlisted companies, no dividend income, high cash in hand, private companies as majority shareholders, low turnover and operating income, nominal expenses, nominal statutory payments and stock in trade, besides minimum fixed assets. 

Among the non-Kolkata addresses, a Connaught Place address is the third most common with 311 companies. A Jubilee Hills Road address in Hyderabad is the sixth most common address with 244 (largely agro) companies registered. 

HARD TO TRACE OWNERSHIP 

Such proliferation makes it hard to trace ownership. 

‚ÄúThis could all be easily tackled through a mandatory requirement of declaration of natural persons. And, of course, if a company wrongly declares a natural person, the benami law is there to tackle such wrong declarations,‚Äù said Kothari. 

‚ÄúThere is a global trend to find the natural persons behind a corporate. This is the concept of ‚Äòultimate beneficial owner‚Äô which is behind Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) regulations, as well as US Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act (FATCA) regulations... It is important, no matter what regulation ensures this, to ensure that the identity of natural persons behind a company be established.‚Äù 

The PMO said harsh penalties will meted out to deviant shell companies including freezing of bank accounts, striking off the names of dormant companies and invocation of Benami Transactions (Prohibition) Amendment Act, 2016.

thread.title: New Thor: Ragnarok Concept Art and Team Thor Video
thread.title_full: New Thor: Ragnarok Concept Art and Team Thor Video

posts.author: Max Evry
posts.title: New Thor: Ragnarok Concept Art and Team Thor Video
posts.text:
SHARE New Thor: Ragnarok concept art and Team Thor video 
Marvel Studios ‚Äò upcoming threequel Thor: Ragnarok has revealed new concept art and a new Team Thor video for the Taika Waititi film. Check out the Thor: Ragnarok concept art screengrabs from the Doctor Strange Digital HD release in the gallery below, along with the hilarious Team Thor video below! 
Click here to order your digital copy of Doctor Strange with bonus features! 
In Marvel Studios‚Äô Thor: Ragnarok , Thor is imprisoned on the other side of the universe without his mighty hammer and finds himself in a race against time to get back to Asgard to stop Ragnarok ‚Äì the destruction of his homeworld and the end of Asgardian civilization ‚Äì at the hands of an all-powerful new threat, the ruthless Hela. But first he must survive a deadly gladatorial contest that pits him against his former ally and fellow Avenger ‚Äì the Incredible Hulk! 
Thor: Ragnarok will feature the return of Chris Hemsworth as the God of Thunder himself, with Tom Hiddleston as Loki, Mark Ruffalo as the Hulk, Idris Elba as Heimdall and Sir Anthony Hopkins again portraying Odin. Cate Blanchett plays the mysterious and powerful new villain Hela, Jeff Goldblum stars as the eccentric Grandmaster, Tessa Thompson will bring the classic hero Valkyrie to life on the big screen, and Karl Urban will add his might to the fray as Skurge. Also among the cast is Sam Neill, reuniting with Waititi, who directed him in his previous film Hunt for the Wilderpeople , and his Jurassic Park co-star Jeff Goldblum. Finally, as teased at the end of his solo film, Benedict Cumberbatch‚Äôs Doctor Strange will team with the God of Thunder to deal with Loki. 
Kevin Feige will produce the film, joined by executive producers Louis D‚ÄôEsposito, Brad Winderbaum, Victoria Alonso, Thomas M. Hammel and Stan Lee. The screenplay hails from Stephany Folsom, Craig Kyle, Eric Pearson and Christopher Yost. 
Thor: Ragnarok will smash its way into theaters on November 3, 2017. 
What do you think of the visuals for Thor: Ragnarok ? Sound off in the comments below!

thread.title: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News

posts.author: Evan Bartlett
posts.title: Manchester United: Zlatan targets 'two or three' trophies this season | Metro News
posts.text:
Zlatan Ibrahimovic is targeting ‚Äòtwo or three‚Äô trophies at Manchester United this season Evan Bartlett Sunday 12 Feb 2017 7:03 pm No one can call Zlatan a pessimist (Getty Images) 
Manchester United may be struggling to even qualify for the Champions League this season, but Zlatan Ibrahimovic believes they can still win ‚Äòtwo or three‚Äô trophies this season. 
Centre-forwards are supposed to be well past their prime at 35 but the Swede has been in imperious form this season, hitting 15 goals in the league. 
And United will need him to continue that run if they are to secure the silverware he‚Äôs hoping for. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
‚ÄòWe just need to keep going,‚Äô Ibrahimovic said this weekend. 
But it‚Äôs not the Premier League ‚Äì where United beat Watford 2-0 on Saturday ‚Äì but in the Europa League, FA Cup and EFL Cup where he is targeting success. Ibrahimovic has been in imperious form this season (Getty Images) 
‚ÄòWe want to go through the Europa League and we have a good game at home against St Etienne,‚Äô Ibrahimovic added. ‚ÄòFrom five trophies this season we have won one [the Community Shield] and we are still in four. Manchester United fixtures 
St-Etienne ‚Äì Europa (H) Thu 16 Feb Blackburn ‚Äì FA Cup (A) ‚Äì Sat 18 Feb St-Etienne ‚Äì Europa (A) ‚Äì Wed 22 Feb Southampton ‚Äì EFL (N) ‚Äì Sun 26 Feb Bournemouth (H) ‚Äì Sat 4 Mar Southampton (A) ‚Äì Sun 12 Mar ‚ÄòI think from the teams in front, only one will become champions. The rest will not get a trophy, but we have one and we can get our second one. ‚ÄòAnd we are still in the Europa League and FA Cup, so if we don‚Äôt become champions in the Premier League at least we can try and win two or three trophies.‚Äô

thread.title: Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago club has a new feature: Watch the president discuss top secret security issues!
thread.title_full: Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago club has a new feature: Watch the president discuss top secret security issues!

posts.author: Matthew Rozsa
posts.title: Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago club has a new feature: Watch the president discuss top secret security issues!
posts.text:
Monday, Feb 13, 2017 7:04 PM UTC Donald Trump‚Äôs Mar-a-Lago club has a new feature: Watch the president discuss top secret security issues! Trump discussed top secret matters in the open, in front of Mar-a-Lago members and guests Topics: Donald Trump , Mar-a-Lago , nuclear football , News , Politics News (Credit: AP Photo/Susan Walsh) 
President Donald Trump‚Äôs lax security is raising eyebrows, particularly among observers who remember his harsh criticisms of Hillary Clinton‚Äôs private email server during the 2016 presidential election. 
When Trump was informed that North Korea had launched an intermediate-range ballistic missile during his Mar-a-Lago dinner on Saturday night, he and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe did not leave the room. Instead they made crucial foreign policy decisions right there in front of their guests, allowing the event to be plastered all over social media. . @POTUS was dealing w/ matter of nat'l security in the dining room of his club. 
A member took photos & posted to social media. 
‚Äî Mo Elleithee (@MoElleithee) February 13, 2017 @anamariecox Guy at mar a lago posted pic of Trump getting NK test missile intel and its public in his FB page rn pic.twitter.com/T6z5YvXJ7R 
‚Äî PersistentWoman (@carleab) February 13, 2017 
One Mar-a-Lago club member also posted a picture of himself that night with the military official who holds the so-called ‚Äúnuclear football,‚Äù which contains the information President Trump will need in the event he needs to launch nuclear weapons away from the usual command centers. The tweet even identified the person by his first name. Mar-a-Lago member who pays Trump hundreds of thousands of dollars posts pics of ‚Äì and identifies ‚Äì US official carrying nuclear football. pic.twitter.com/oyAfY0E9Fj 
‚Äî Samuel Oakford (@samueloakford) February 13, 2017 
Perhaps the most ominous detail of Saturday night, though, was the pervasive use of cell phones throughout the evening. 
‚ÄúMobile phones have flashlights, yes ‚Äî and cameras, microphones and Internet connectivity,‚Äù explained Philip Bump of The Washington Post. ‚ÄúWhen Edward Snowden was meeting with reporters in Hong Kong at the moment he was leaking the material he‚Äôd stolen from the NSA, he famously asked that they place their phones in the refrigerator ‚Äî blocking any radio signals in the event that the visitors‚Äô phones had been hacked.‚Äù 
‚ÄúThis was considered the most secure way of ensuring that the phones couldn‚Äôt be used as wiretaps, even more secure than removing the battery,‚Äù Bump goes on to explain. ‚ÄúPhones ‚Äî especially phones with their flashes turned on for improved visibility ‚Äî are portable television satellite trucks and, if compromised, can be used to get a great deal of information about what‚Äôs happening nearby, unless precautions are taken.‚Äù 
Photographs from the event show Trump using a phone during the foreign policy conversation. If he was using his preferred outdated Android device, this would have been especially troubling, as it has been established that that phone is very easy to hack . 
Trump‚Äôs behavior is in stark contrast to how past presidents have handled secret information. That dining room is definitely not a SCIF. pic.twitter.com/Bm6psfmwAR 
‚Äî Jason Sparks (@sparksjls) February 13, 2017 
If there is a security problem, this may be a job for Congress. After all, House Speaker Paul Ryan said last year that people who are ‚Äúextremely careless‚Äù with classified information ‚Äúshould be denied further access to such info.‚Äù Individuals who are "extremely careless" with classified information should be denied further access to such info. pic.twitter.com/0C76Ae95LD 
‚Äî Paul Ryan (@SpeakerRyan) July 7, 2016 
Matthew Rozsa is a breaking news writer for Salon. He holds an MA in History from Rutgers University-Newark and his work has appeared in Mic, Quartz and MSNBC.

thread.title: Giornata mondiale epilessia, la storia di Lucrezia e Francesco per combattere lo stigma
thread.title_full: Giornata mondiale epilessia, la storia di Lucrezia e Francesco per combattere lo stigma - Repubblica.it

posts.author: GIULIA ALICE FORNARO
posts.title: Giornata mondiale epilessia, la storia di Lucrezia e Francesco per combattere lo stigma
posts.text:
IL VIOLA, √® il colore simbolo dell‚Äôepilessia riconosciuto a livello internazionale. Per questo luned√¨ 13 febbraio, in occasione della G iornata mondiale per l‚Äôepilessia molti palazzi e monumenti italiani si tingeranno di questo colore. Come la Barcaccia in piazza di Spagna a Roma, piazza del plebiscito a Napoli, la fontana di piazza De Ferrari a Genova, il palazzo della provincia di Sassari e la facciata di C√† Farsetti a Venezia sul Canal Grande.
LEGGI "Discrimanti anche dopo la guarigione, la battaglia per cambiare la legge"
Uno stigma da sconfiggere. Indetta dal 2002 come giornata nazionale dall‚Äôanno scorso la giornata italiana si √® unita a quella indetta nel mondo dall‚ÄôInternational Bureau for Epilepsy (Ibe) e l‚ÄôInternational League Against Epilepsy (Ilae) il secondo luned√¨ del mese di febbraio, per aumentare la consapevolezza sui problemi affrontati ogni giorno dalle persone con epilessia e dai loro familiari. Il desiderio √® anche quello di diffondere una giusta informazione su questa malattia, che se da una parte interessa un importante numero di persone, l‚Äô1% della popolazione, 500mila in Italia, dall‚Äôaltra parte si accompagna ancora allo stigma sociale che tradizionalmente, ed erroneamente, la confonde con la malattia mentale. Spingendo cos√¨ le persone affette a rimanere nell‚Äôombra. Pena: perdita del lavoro, della patente o rinuncia a praticare determinati sport, rendendo ancora pi√π difficile l‚Äôacquisizione di riconoscimenti e diritti fondamentali da parte dei malati. L‚Äôepilessia √® una malattia neurologica e " il sintomo di qualcosa che non va nel cervello, un organo estremamente complesso ‚Äì afferma Carlo Di Bonavertura neurologo del Policlinico Umberto I di Roma ‚Äì da qui la complessit√† e la variabilit√† delle epilessie". Le dissonanze di Lucrezia e Francesco Condividi
Il docufilm. Out of he shadow, dunque, fuori dall‚Äôombra, √® il motto della campagna 2017 in occasione della quale Lice presenta " Dissonanze ", un documentario sul vivere con l'epilessia in cui si racconta la storia di Lucrezia Codella e Francesco Sarnari, affetti da epilessie farmacoresistenti, che, grazie alla collaborazione delle sezioni regionali Lice e delle associazioni dei pazienti, verr√† proiettato in molte citt√† italiane. Lo scopo √® quello di aprire un dibattito tra i medici ed i pazienti, che servir√† per stimolare la discussione ed aumentare quindi l'informazione sull'epilessia. ‚ÄúPienamente nello spirito del documentario √® il post su facebook della protagonista Lucrezia ‚Äì afferma Oriano Mecarelli, neuropsichiatra della Sapienza e segretario Lice, che ha curato la realizzazione del documentario ‚Äì Parole che fanno venire i brividi‚Äù. Il premio giornalistico. Allo scopo di stimolare una divulgazione il pi√π possibile competente, rigorosa e chiara sulle epilessie, Lice ha indetto un premio giornalistico patrocinato dall'Ordine dei Giornalisti, dall'Unione Giornalisti Italiani Scientifici e dalla Sapienza - Universit√† di Roma. Premio che ha visto come vincitrici Lilia Gentili con l'articolo dal titolo "Io, mamma con l'epilessia" pubblicato sul periodico "Pi√π Sani e pi√π Belli" e, per la sezione under 35, Sara Moraca, con "A Scuola di epilessia", un articolo pubblicato sulla testata online Pagina99.
Epilessia a scuola. E proprio a proposito di scuola, il 13 febbraio l‚Äôospedale pediatrico Bambino Ges√π organizza all‚Äôauditorium della sede di Roma, due incontri, uno alle ore 10.30 e l‚Äôaltro alle 15, con gli insegnanti di otre 50 istituti scolastici dal titolo ‚ÄúLa scuola non ha paura delle crisi‚Äù per mostrare agli operatori scolastici come gestire una crisi convulsiva in classe. Preparare la scuola in questo senso √® un aspetto molto importante dato che nei due terzi dei casi la malattia si manifesta prima della pubert√†. Sulla stessa lunghezza d‚Äôonda la S.C. di Neuropsichiatria Infantile della ASL CN1 di Mondov√¨, in provincia di Cuneo, durante le giornate di luned√¨ 13, marted√¨ 14 e mercoled√¨ 15 propone seminari pratici e teorici mirati a insegnare le procedure di primo soccorso in caso di crisi convulsiva, nonch√© informazioni sulla normativa vigente rispetto alla somministrazione di farmaci antiepilettici in ambito scolastico.
 Epilessia e sport: quali fare e quali no Altre iniziative. Diverse poi sono le iniziative, tra ambulatori aperti per counselling e visite gratuite ed eventi informativi e di sensibilizzazione, organizzate nelle varie Regioni d‚ÄôItalia. La Puglia, per esempio ha indetto per Febbraio ‚Äúil mese dell‚Äôepilessia‚Äù, con un calendario ricco di date. Si pu√≤ trovarne una mappa sul sito www.fondazioneepilessialice.it .
 Tags Argomenti: epilessia giornata mondiale epilessia Protagonisti:

thread.title: First picture of dad killed after 'fight sparked by wet floor sign' at Tenerife hotel
thread.title_full: First picture of dad killed after 'fight sparked by wet floor sign' at Tenerife hotel

posts.author: Scarlet Howes
posts.title: First picture of dad killed after 'fight sparked by wet floor sign' at Tenerife hotel
posts.text:
News First picture of dad killed after 'fight sparked by wet floor sign' at Tenerife hotel The dad-of-two lost his battle for life in hospital after being seriously injured when a wet floor sign was reportedly thrown during row Share Tragic victim has been named as company director Daryl Bhandal (Photo: SOLARPIX.COM) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A Brit holidaymaker who died after a violent fight at a Tenerife hotel where he was celebrating his birthday has been named as company director Daryl Bhandal. 
The 36-year-old dad-of-two lost his battle for life in hospital after being seriously injured in a fracas between two Brit couples said to have been sparked after he was hit with a cleaner‚Äôs wet floor sign. 
The incident happened around midnight on Friday at an unnamed hotel in the resort of Puerto de Santiago in the south west of the island. 
The suspected killer and his girlfriend, both British tourists said to have been involved in the violent altercation with the dead man and his partner, have been arrested. 
It is not known at this stage if the four were friends, although they are understood to have jetted to Tenerife the same day just hours before the incident and were staying at the same hotel. The Brit was rushed to a hospital in the south of the island with severe head injuries but died (Photo: SOLARPIX.COM) 
Pals took to social media to pay tribute to Mr Bhandal, from Woolwich, south east London, today. 
One said of the keep fit fanatic, who ran a building firm: ‚ÄúGutted to hear about Daryl Bhandal. 
‚ÄúMy thoughts are with his family and friends. RIP mate.‚Äù 
Graphic designer Brad Mulock added: ‚ÄúDaryl Bhandal. Unbelievable. Totally and utterly unbelievable. RIP mate.‚Äù Pals took to social media to pay tribute to David, from Woolwich, south east London (Photo: SOLARPIX.COM) 
Pal Richard Specter said: ‚ÄúRIP Daryl Bhandal. Absolute pleasure knowing you. Top bloke and a brilliant father. I know a lot of us are in shock and rightfully so. 
‚ÄúAnd for everyone paying tributes, I‚Äôm sure it‚Äôll be a huge comfort to his family to know he‚Äôll be missed by so many people. Sleep tight big guy.‚Äù 
Another Facebook post, written before the tragedy in the early hours of Saturday morning, revealed how Mr Bhandal had gone out with his young son and daughter on Boxing Day to hand out warm clothes to the homeless. 
Quality Solutions Group, the firm he was a director of, said it was footing the bill for all the clothes. The 36-year-old dad-of-two lost his battle for life in hospital after violent row (Photo: SOLARPIX.COM) 
Police on the island were not immediately available Monday morning to comment on the two arrests. 
The man detained over Daryl‚Äôs death, who was reportedly held by local police as he tried to flee the scene, is understood to have received hospital treatment for minor facial injuries. 
His partner was held on suspicion of throwing the wet floor sign at Daryl during a verbal row which led to the violent altercation. The incident happened around midnight on Friday at an unnamed hotel in Puerto de Santiago (Photo: SOLARPIX.COM) 
The Brit building firm director was rushed to a hospital in the south of the island with severe head injuries but died around 3am on Saturday morning. 
A local judge has been put in charge of the case. Like us on Facebook

thread.title: Manchester United news: Marouane Fellaini reveals huge show of trust from Jose Mourinho | Metro News
thread.title_full: Manchester United news: Marouane Fellaini reveals huge show of trust from Jose Mourinho | Metro News

posts.author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
posts.title: Manchester United news: Marouane Fellaini reveals huge show of trust from Jose Mourinho | Metro News
posts.text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 12:57 pm Marouane Fellaini has improved this season (Picture: Getty) 
Marouane Fellaini has revealed he received a surprise show of faith from Manchester United manager Jose Mourinho before the start of the season. Mesut Ozil suffering CRISIS of confidence, admits Arsenal boss Wenger 
The Belgium international had had an indifferent few years at Old Trafford under previous bosses David Moyes and Louis van Gaal, but now looks more at home after the arrival of Mourinho in the summer. 
The Portuguese has trusted Fellaini in some big games this season, and the player himself feels this has been a big lift to his mood and form this term. Fellaini has hit it off with new manager Jose Mourinho (Picture: Getty) 
‚ÄòI‚Äôve always had good relationships with managers. But with Jose I have a great relationship. I respect him, he gives me confidence,‚Äô Fellaini told the Daily Mirror . 
‚ÄòHe called me and texted me on my holiday to give me confidence and say he trusts me.

thread.title: How does Verizon's unlimited plan stack up against the others - CNET
thread.title_full: How does Verizon's unlimited plan stack up against the others - CNET

posts.author: Patrick Holland
posts.title: How does Verizon's unlimited plan stack up against the others - CNET
posts.text:
Verizon: 22GB Cost for single line 
Obviously, one of the reasons unlimited plans exist are to offer lots of data at a reasonable price -- reasonable enough to beat overage charges. Here's what a single line of unlimited data on each carrier costs: AT&T: $100/month (in addition to the required DirectTV/U-verse service so total cost is $150/month) Sprint: $55/month (with a $5/month AutoPay discount) T-Mobile One: $70/month (with a $5/month AutoPay discount) Verizon: $80/month (with a $5/month AutoPay discount) 
A couple notes on theses plans: The plans for AT&T, Sprint and Verizon do not include taxes, surcharges or additional fees At the time of this writing, Sprint has a promotion where its unlimited data plan is only $50/month through March 31, 2018. Cost for additional lines 
If you need additional lines of unlimited data, each of the big four have a range of prices: AT&T: $100/month first line, $40/month for each additional line Sprint: $55/month first line, $40/month for a 2nd line, $30/month for lines 3-5 T-Mobile: $100/month for first two lines, or $47/month each for three lines, or $40 each for four lines Verizon: $80/month first line, $45/month for each additional line 
Sprint's current promotion offers a 2nd line for $40/month and lines 3-5 for $0/month -- this reverts back to regular pricing after March 31, 2018. 
Each carrier has different rules around streaming hd video. HD video versus SD video 
Verizon and T-Mobile both offer HD video streaming included in their plans -- T-Mobile changed this in reaction to Verizon's announcement of its unlimited plan. AT&T does something similar, but defaults video streaming to standard definition (480p instead of 1080p). AT&T let's you disable this at no cost. 
The baseline unlimited plan from Sprint only lets you stream standard definition video (think DVD quality). Though, Sprint offers a premium unlimited plan for $75/month that lets you stream HD video. 
Below is the cost of an unlimited plan with HD video streaming for a single line: AT&T - $100/month ($150/month with required DirectTV/U-verse service) Sprint Premium - $75/month Verizon - $80/month Mobile hotspot data 
If you use your phone as a mobile hotspot, keep in mind each carrier has its own limits on just how much data can be used for that -- this is one of the biggest differentiators between unlimited plans. Verizon - 10GB/month of mobile hotspot data T-Mobile - 10GB/month of mobile hotspot data Sprint - 5GB/month of mobile hotspot data on either of Sprint's unlimited plans AT&T Unlimited - mobile hotspot only available when connected with a smart car The final word 
It is truly wonderful to have options from all four major US carriers for unlimited data plans. This comparison of costs and features is just part of the picture though. Keep in mind other costs: cost of phone, extended warranties, taxes, surcharges and activation fees -- the last three T-Mobile have factored into its pricing. It's also worth considering the network coverage and quality of that coverage, too. Share your voice

A soli 13 anni, dopo una serata in discoteca con gli amici evidentemente ad alto tasso alcolico, √® finita in ospedale con tutti i sintomi da pre coma etilico. √à quanto accaduto nel fine settimana ad una giovanissima ragazzina umbra in una discoteca di Montecchio, in provincia di Pesaro Urbino. Fortunatamente per lei, √® stata subito soccorsa dai presenti che si sono accorti del suo stato mentre era svenuta in bagno e poi immediatamente portata al pronto soccorso dell'ospedale dove l'hanno ricoverata e sottoposta alle cure del caso e ora si sta riprendendo. 
Nella stessa serata per√≤ con lei sono finite in ospedale anche altre due ragazze un po' pi√π grandi, una 17enne e una 20enne che si trovavano nello stesso locale. Proprio per questo l'episodio √® ora al vaglio dei carabinieri della locale stazione assieme a quelli di Pesaro. Le tre ragazze soccorse non erano amiche e non si conoscevano tra loro ma tutte e tre sono riuscite con facilit√† a procurarsi grosse quantit√† di vodka e gin durante la serata nonostante due di loro fossero minorenni. I militari dell'arma ora dovranno accertare se l'alcol si stato consegnato loro fuori o dentro il locale visto che all'esterno della discoteca i soccorritori avrebbero visto decine di bottiglie di superalcolici vuote. thread.title: Real Madrid: La preocupaci√≥n de Morata - AS.com
thread.title_full: Real Madrid: La preocupaci√≥n de Morata - AS.com

posts.author: Sergio G Mez
posts.title: Real Madrid: La preocupaci√≥n de Morata - AS.com
posts.text:
FELIPE SEVILLANO DIARIO AS El canterano est√° inquieto ante las pocas oportunidades que le da Zidane. No se va a rendir, pero si su situaci√≥n no cambia, en verano se plantear√° su futuro. 13 febrero 2017 13:34h CET 
√Ålvaro Morata est√° inquieto con su situaci√≥n . Ante Osasuna estuvo calentando gran parte de la segunda parte y Zidane le dej√≥ sin jugar ni un solo minuto. Tir√≥ de James como primer cambio tras la lesi√≥n de Danilo para deshacer su propuesta de tres centrales y volver a la l√≠nea de cuatro. Una decisi√≥n comprensible viendo el mal desempe√±o del equipo con el 3-5-2. Sin embargo, cuando opt√≥ por quitar a Benzema en el 72‚Äô, con 1-2 en el marcador, prefiri√≥ dar entrada al campo a Lucas V√°zquez. Kovacic fue el tercer cambio (entr√≥ en el 8‚Äô por Isco). 
Morata est√° preocupado por esa falta de protagonismo. Y, como jugador ambicioso que es, no lo oculta. ‚ÄúQuiero jugar m√°s‚Äù, insisti√≥ en una entrevista en Il Corriere dello Sport. Pese al alarmante momento de forma que atraviesa Benzema (lleva un mes sin hacer un gol: el √∫ltimo lo hizo ante el Sevilla el 12 de enero), Zidane y la planta noble del club ha seguido respaldando al franc√©s. Precisamente, ese encuentro de Copa ante el Sevilla fue el √∫ltimo que jug√≥ Morata de titular (en 2017, de nueve encuentros s√≥lo sali√≥ de inicio en dos y se qued√≥ sin disputar un solo minuto en tres) a pesar de tener mejores n√∫meros que Benzema. El madrile√±o ha jugado 657 minutos menos que el delantero galo (1.172‚Äô frente a 1.829‚Äô) y tiene mejor promedio goleador que √©l: lleva 10 tantos y marca uno cada 117 minutos mientras que Karim ha marcado s√≥lo dos goles m√°s y su media es de un tanto cada 152 minutos‚Ä¶ Y el Madrid ya tiene en su agenda renovar a Benzema en verano‚Ä¶ 
Morata regres√≥ este verano al club de su coraz√≥n despu√©s de agigantarse durante dos a√±os en la Juventus con la idea de triunfar, pero si su situaci√≥n sigue igual, se plantear√° su futuro en verano (tiene 24 a√±os y contrato hasta 2022). Eso s√≠, el jugador no va a montar ning√∫n incendio. Perseverante como nadie, no se va a rendir y quiere exprimirse en el d√≠a a d√≠a y en los minutos que le conceda Zidane para pon√©rselo complicado al t√©cnico. As√≠ lo hizo en su √∫ltimo encuentro, ante la Real Sociedad en el Bernab√©u: con 2-0, sali√≥ en el 66‚Äô sustituyendo a un nulo Benzema y en 24 minutos marc√≥ un gol. Su futuro. 
Ofertas no le van a faltar al canterano blanco. Su hoja de servicios en las dos temporadas en la Juventus le hicieron construirse una gran fama en Italia y la Premier lleva varios a√±os monitoriz√°ndole. Conte, el entrenador que le llev√≥ a la Juventus, no ha dejado de tenerle en sus pensamientos. Igual que el Arsenal, para quien Morata es un anhelo desde que jugaba en el Castilla. Este mi√©rcoles, el Real Madrid se enfrenta al N√°poles en la ida de octavos de final de la Champions. En principio, ser√° suplente ante un equipo que le ha marcado tres goles en cinco encuentros en Italia. Pero aguardar√° la oportunidad, nuevamente, con sangre en el ojo‚Ä¶

M√©xico.- La Secretar√≠a de Hacienda inform√≥ este lunes de la clausura de siete estaciones de servicio en los estados de Chiapas, M√©xico, Michoac√°n, Oaxaca y Veracruz debido a diversas irregularidades fiscales y operativas. 
En un comunicado, la dependencia detall√≥ que ‚Äúestas gasolineras se encuentran ubicadas en Buenavista y Maravat√≠o, Michoac√°n; Ecatepec de Morelos y Malinalco, Estado de M√©xico; Agua Dulce, Veracruz; Juchit√°n de Zaragoza, Oaxaca; y Frontera Comalapa; Chiapas‚Äù. 
En todas estas localidades se llevaron a cabo operativos coordinandos entre la Procuradur√≠a Federal del Consumidor (Profeco), Petr√≥leos Mexicanos y el Servicio de Administraci√≥n Tributaria (SAT). 
Adem√°s, Hacienda indic√≥ que se llevan a cabo operativos para detectar el mercado il√≠citos de combustible, conducta que muchas veces est√° relacionada al lavado de dinero y al crimen organizado. Notas relacionadas

thread.title: The Circus Is Closing, And I‚Äôm Not Sad
thread.title_full: The Circus Is Closing, And I‚Äôm Not Sad

posts.author: Christine Organ
posts.title: The Circus Is Closing, And I‚Äôm Not Sad
posts.text:
Christine Organ Feb 13, 2017 
The owners of Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus recently announced that they will be shutting down in May, ending its 146-year run. Some people gasped in surprise, others grew nostalgic, and others clapped their hands in celebration. 
Personally, I wondered to myself, what took so freaking long ? 
As with most changes, the closing of the circus is complicated and not without its downsides. There will be job losses for people who have been a part of the circus culture for generations. Animals will need new homes. And an American tradition is gone. 
But given that this ‚Äútradition‚Äù is shrouded in cruelty and abuse, quite frankly, it‚Äôs long past time to say goodbye. 
Sure, many of us have fond memories of the circus, with our rose-colored images of the train rolling into town filled with interesting people and majestic-looking animals that seemed magical to our young and tender eyes. We weren‚Äôt aware of what went on behind the scenes, and we didn‚Äôt want to know. 
Later, as we learned more and saw more, we chose not to know. We pretended we didn‚Äôt know. But deep down, many of us knew ‚Äî on some level ‚Äî that something wasn‚Äôt quite right. Maybe it was the bullhook or the first time we saw an animal whipped. Maybe it was the small, dirty cages. Maybe it was seeing a stately elephant walk in circles or putting their gigantic feet on a tiny pedestal and twirling around, and then thinking, that doesn‚Äôt seem natural . 
Maybe the epiphany didn‚Äôt come until later in life after we read Water for Elephants as an adult or when we read The One and Only Ivan to our kids. Maybe we saw a documentary or read the news stories about the death of Kenny , a 3-year-old Asian elephant traveling with the Ringling Bros. Circus. in 1998. Maybe we read about the investigations into animal cruelty, including a Mother Jones investigation that found rampant disease, separation of elephant babies from their mothers, and prolonged periods of time spent in chains. 
Personally, I‚Äôve never been a huge fan of the circus. I‚Äôm an animal lover and consider my pets to be family. In our house, we don‚Äôt step on ants, spiders, and other creepy-crawlies, and I‚Äôve been known to let a mouse run across my living room for a few weeks while exhausting all humane forms of capture because I didn‚Äôt want to hurt it. 
I‚Äôve only been to a few circus shows in my life. As a child, I loved the cotton candy and the acrobats with their sequined costumes. As an adult, my discomfort grew, but I loved seeing my son‚Äôs face light up and hearing him squeal with delight when we took him to the circus as a toddler. He rode the elephants, marveled at the tigers performing just a few feet away from where we sat, and I ignored the nagging feeling in the pit of my stomach telling me that this is just not right . 
The circus has been under fire for years for animal treatment practices that are questionable at best, horrific at worst. The truth stayed hidden or ignored by the public ‚Äî including me ‚Äî for a long time, but as the stories started trickling out about the cruelty and negligence, it became impossible for many people to turn away. 
‚ÄúWe didn‚Äôt know any better,‚Äù Jan Creamer, the president of Animal Defenders International, told USA Today . ‚ÄúNow, we do. As Ringling has found out, people are better educated and recognize suffering and cruelty in other species. They don‚Äôt want to see animals suffer for 15 minutes of entertainment.‚Äù 
The circus‚Äôs closing might be bittersweet for some, but it‚Äôs far more sweet than bitter to me. Personally, I don‚Äôt want to see an animal suffer for 15 minutes or 15 seconds. Period. Sure, there are jobs affected by the circus closing, but it doesn‚Äôt need to be a zero sum game. We can protect animals and find employment for the workers. We can have fun with our families and expose them to animals ‚Äî domestic and wild ‚Äî without sacrificing the quality of life of the animals for our entertainment. Parents can take their kids to animal sanctuaries or Cirque du Soleil. Spend an afternoon walking dogs or playing with kittens at a local animal shelter. Adopt an endangered animal by checking out the World Wildlife Fund. 
We can be kind to humans and animals. It‚Äôs not an either-or proposition. We‚Äôre all animals, after all. So while a few people are swimming in nostalgia for what some called the ‚Äúgreatest show on earth,‚Äù I, for one, am relieved and elated to see the show come to an end. 
And don‚Äôt even get me started on the clowns .

thread.title: Libro escolar compara comunismo con "Los Pitufos"
thread.title_full: Libro escolar compara comunismo con "Los Pitufos"

posts.title: Libro escolar compara comunismo con "Los Pitufos"
posts.text:
INICIO // Cultura // Letras // Libro escolar compara comunismo con "Los Pitufos" Libro escolar compara comunismo con "Los Pitufos" La oposici√≥n uruguaya pedir√° explicaciones a la ministra de Educaci√≥n y Cultura por la pol√©mica suscitada por la obra - A + A 
La oposici√≥n uruguaya pedir√° explicaciones a la ministra de Educaci√≥n y Cultura , Mar√≠a Julia Mu√±oz, por la pol√©mica suscitada por un libro de historia escolar que compara al comunismo con la forma de vida de Los Pitufos , dijo hoy el diputado del Partido Nacional (PN) Pablo Iturralde. 
El libro, destinado a estudiantes de sexto grado de escuela, se titula Uy-siglo XX y en una de sus p√°ginas ejemplifica a la comunidad del popular dibujo animado con el comunismo "para acercarte a la idea de la sociedad comunista". 
"¬øConoces a Los Pitufos? Son una comunidad que vive en una aldea. Todos tienen acceso a la vivienda. Nadie pasa hambre", explica el libro, escrito por la profesora Silvana Pera . 
Las apreciaciones que da sobre la ideolog√≠a despertaron la molestia de los integrantes de la oposici√≥n que r√°pidamente se manifestaron en las redes sociales pidiendo explicaci√≥n a las autoridades de turno. Art√≠culo Cultura "Mexican-American Heritage" (Herencia mexicano-estadounidense), que espera su aprobaci√≥n para convertirse en texto escolar, fue calificado de "ofensivo" y "racista" 
El que difundi√≥ la ilustraci√≥n fue Iturralde, quien afirm√≥ que realizar√° un pedido de informes al Ministerio de Educaci√≥n y Cultura. 
"El tema es el mismo de siempre lo sesgado del enfoque que se le da a los libros que se abordan, como se tratan de imponer formas de pensar a trav√©s de todo medio cultural", dijo Iturralde. 
Asimismo, el diputado manifest√≥ que ya tiene en su poder el libro y que pr√≥ximamente elaborar√° un informe sobre el libro y su contenido. 
Foto: escool.uy 
El consejero de Educaci√≥n Inicial y Primaria, H√©ctor Florit, dijo al diario local El Observador que se trata de una "comparaci√≥n desafortunada", y puntualiz√≥ que este libro no se utiliza en escuelas p√∫blicas y que los textos que se utilizan en instituciones privadas "no tienen ni censura, ni control" y se producen de manera independiente a los que se generan para Primaria. 
Si bien el tema reci√©n se puso en discusi√≥n, diferentes miembros del PN han mostrado su apoyo a Iturralde y su indignaci√≥n sobre el libro. Art√≠culo Ciencia y Salud Un libro escolar para ni√±os en la India instru√≠a a los estudiantes a colocar dos gatos en cajas sin hoyos para comprobar la importancia del oxigeno 
"Sale pedido de informes y llamado Comisi√≥n al Ministerio de Educaci√≥n y Cultura (MEC). No es la primera vez. Ya interpel√© a un Ministro por algo similar", puso el senador y l√≠der del PN Luis Lacalle Pou en su cuenta de Twitter. 
Por otra parte, la diputada del PN expres√≥ en su cuenta que de ser cierto el libro que circula en las redes, se deben exigir "medidas urgentes". 
"¬øNo les llama la atenci√≥n que el Consejo de Educaci√≥n Inicial y Primaria, no haya desmentido el uso del texto del comunismo y los Pitufos?", a√±adi√≥.

thread.title: Sydney man admits to crashing, killing three mates while high on MDMA - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Sydney man admits to crashing, killing three mates while high on MDMA - Yahoo7

posts.author: Alex Hart
posts.title: Sydney man admits to crashing, killing three mates while high on MDMA - Yahoo7
posts.text:
Share Sydney man admits to crashing, killing three mates while high on MDMA - Yahoo7 A young Sydney man has admitted causing a crash which killed three of his best mates. Close Man high on MDMA admits causing horror fatal crash UP NEXT VIDEO Man high on MDMA admits causing horror fatal crash. Source: Seven News Man high on MDMA admits causing horror fatal crash 
Jordan Brown, 21, was high on the drug MDMA as the group returned home following a three day music festival two years ago. 
Dark sunglasses concealed his eyes but could not hide his pain when Brown appeared in court on Monday. 
‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry. I just apologise enough for what this has done to everyone,‚Äù he said. Ben Sawyer, Lachlan Burleigh and Luke Shanahan were killed when the Mitsubishi Jordan Brown was driving lost control. Photo: 7 News 
Ben Sawyer, Lachlan Burleigh and Luke Shanahan all died in the crash. 
Brown pleaded guilty to causing their deaths at Bilpin in the Blue Mountains in August 2015. 
The friends had been on their way home from the Psyfari music festival at Lithgow. 
Brown lost control of his Mitsubishi, spinning across the road into Barbara and Peter McLaren‚Äôs oncoming Subaru. Barbara and Peter McLaren were headed in the other direction when the out of control car struck theirs. Photo: 7 News 
He was high on MDMA at the time. 
He told police: ‚ÄúEverything then happened quickly and is a blur.‚Äù 
‚ÄúI heard a bang and next thing I remember is the vehicle being on its side.‚Äù 
His surviving front seat passenger Daniel Richards said: ‚ÄúJordan didn‚Äôt say anything about what happened, he was just crying.‚Äù Jordan Brown's fate now lies in the hands of a judge. Photo: 7 News 
‚ÄúBy the time I left I knew what had happened to the other boys, that they had died.‚Äù 
Barbara McLaren, 84, broke her leg a suffered a stroke the following day. She is still recovering. 
Had Brown pleaded guilty before his trial was due to begin, he could have received a 25 per cent discount on his sentence. 
Instead he will be hoping remorse is taken into account when the judge decides his fate. 
Brown will be sentenced in April.

posts.title: Why Adele Was So Nervous at the Grammys: How the Show Went Wrong for Her Last Year
posts.text:
Adele may have confused the audience at Sunday night‚Äôs Grammy Awards when she briefly swore and asked to restart her George Michael tribute ‚Äî but this isn‚Äôt the first time the singer struggled through a Grammy performance, as she acknowledged herself.
‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I can‚Äôt do it again like last year,‚Äù Adele said after starting and stopping her live tribute to the late ‚ÄúFaith‚Äù singer, in a reference to a snafu at last year‚Äôs ceremony.
‚ÄúCan we please start it again?‚Äù she asked, as the audience cheered her on . ‚ÄúI‚Äôm sorry, I can‚Äôt mess this up for him.‚Äù
After restarting, Adele sailed through a take on Michael‚Äôs ‚ÄúFirst Love‚Äù ‚Äî a reversal from her appearance at last year‚Äôs Grammys, when technical difficulties marred a performance of ‚ÄúAll I Ask.‚Äù While singing her hit song, the audio cut out briefly and a sound like a guitar tuning interrupted the performance.
Check out PEOPLE‚Äôs full 2017 Grammys coverage. 
‚ÄúDuring changeover and the ad break, the microphones fell onto the piano strings, which is what the guitar noise was ‚Äî some people thought it was Bieber rehearsing but it wasn‚Äôt him,‚Äù Adele joked later while explaining the mess-up on The Ellen DeGeneres Show . ‚ÄúAnd it just kinda put the whole thing off, really.‚Äù
‚ÄúI cried pretty much all day ,‚Äù she said on Ellen . ‚ÄúIn fairness, I would‚Äôve cried if it had gone really well as well. ‚Ä¶ I kept spontaneously bursting into tears yesterday but it was all right, I‚Äôm fine.‚Äù
RELATED VIDEO: What Music‚Äôs Biggest Stars Wore to Their First Grammy Awards 
Adele said she tried to get back on track with that performance last year but just wasn‚Äôt able to.
‚ÄúI knew where the mic was and I wanted to turn around and lift it up, but I froze,‚Äù she said. ‚ÄúBut I actually felt like it went well ‚Ä¶ I‚Äôm always a bit pitch-y anyway.‚Äù
She handled this year‚Äôs performance differently in honor of Michael, who died on Christmas Day last year .
‚ÄúShe was super nervous going into tonight,‚Äù a production source exclusively told PEOPLE . ‚ÄúShe cleared out the stadium for her rehearsal, but it went really well.‚Äù
‚ÄúI really do apologize for swearing,‚Äù Adele said later on Sunday‚Äôs ceremony as she accepted the win for song of the year , adding, ‚Äú means a lot to me.‚Äù
